loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 45 years old and married. With two children in school, Merly works very hard to provide for her family.

Merly runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional rice to sell.

Merly has been in this business for three years. 

In the future Merly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice to sell

loans.name: Turnahan

texts.ru: Турнахан 44 года, замужем, 3 детей, они с радостью помогают по хозяйству. На протяжении многих лет она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Турнахан, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее развитое хозяйство. В наличии есть 0,55 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает кукурузу и клевер, также есть 7 коров и 6 овец. Всю прибыль Турнахан старается вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса и детей, которых считает главной ценностью своей жизни. Турнахан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от ведения бизнеса она будет вкладывать в развитие хозяйства и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Turnahan is 44 years old, married, and has three children. They help with the household with pleasure. For many years Turnahan has worked with field crop cultivation and livestock breeding. 

Thanks to Turnahan's persistent work, she currently has a well-developed farm. She has 0.55 hectares of irrigated land available, where she grows sweet corn and clover. She also has seven cows and six sheep. Turnahan strives to invest all her income in her business and her children, which are the most important things in her life.

Turnahan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock. She will invest the income from her business in developing it, and she would like to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to increase their headcount

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 46 years old. He is married with 5 children, aged between 1 and 14 years, of whom 4 of them go to school. He is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years now. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers for his maize crop. The profits from this business will be used to buy food for home consumption and to pay the school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maize crop

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to resell in her general store business. Cherry has been in this business for two years now. Cherry earns additional income from pig fattening. Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is 38-years old lady, living with her spouse and four sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide better living facilities for her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw from several years now; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw but he does not have sufficient amount to fix the problems with his moto rickshaw. Therefore, Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband would be able to fix his moto rickshaw. She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings in the future.

loans.use: for the maintenance of moto rickshaw.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en: Dauda is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dauda would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Dauda is looking to earn a better income and to provide more food and clothing for his family. Dauda hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell his corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Iliya expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, ensure his children John, Anas and Famela are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Malo

texts.en:
Malo is 68 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a general store selling a variety of items in her community. She has been doing this for eight years. 

Malo needs a loan to buy new chest freezer, a sack of onions, potatoes, coffee bags, a new scale, a cash register machine, deodorants, frozen goods and snacks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2006 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new chest freezer, a sack of onions, potatoes, coffee bags, a new scale, a cash register machine, deodorants, frozen goods and snacks

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 25-year-old married Syrian man who has worked for a year in a restaurant to cover the needs and expenses of his family. He is trying desperately and working hard to provide his family with a better life, but unfortunately, his limited salary is not enough at all. Thus, today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renew his wife's legal residency in Lebanon.

Mahmoud hopes to develop his own business in the future to stay capable of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renew his wife's legal residency in Lebanon

loans.name: Marangatu Rape Group

texts.es:
El grupo Marangatu Rape está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que es un medio a través cual pueden conocer la situación de vida de cada una de las integrantes.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que tiene una pobreza extrema. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que  se dedica a las compras y ventas en su negocio que es una despensa, también se debe destacar el trabajo de la fundación paraguaya, que hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar.
La Sra. Lidia solicita de este préstamo para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, cervezas, caña, etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Marangatu Rape group is in its seventh loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination survey, which is a means through which they can know the life situation of each one of the members.

One of the members is Lidia, who in her last survey showed a poverty level in level one, which is to say that she has extreme poverty. Through her efforts, continuous work, and the application of the basic behaviors of a successful woman, she is improving her poverty situation.  She is equally conscious that this work and effort that she is making should be continuous and permanent to be able to have complete success, so that with it she could offer better well-being to her family. Among the work that she does, she states that she works buying and selling things in her business which is a shop. She also should mention the work of Fundación Paraguaya, which has an on-going process of training and verification that in a way demand and at the same time motivate the women to struggle.

Lidia asks for this loan to purchase drinks such as soft drinks, beer, sugar cane alcohol, etc. which will help her to have a concrete business plan, and improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase drinks such as soft drinks, beer, caña [sugar cane alcohol], etc. to be able to stock her store.

loans.name: Itagia

texts.en:
Itagia is a 48-year-old woman who is married with six children. She owns and operates a retail store and also a BBQ stall to earn more income. 

Itagia needs a loan to buy snacks; bags of flour, sugar and rice; frozen goods; canned items; a new freezer; a display fridge; two new barbeque sets; and soya sauce. 

She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and also help with her children's education. Itagia joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy snacks; bags of flour, sugar and rice; soya sauce; frozen goods; canned items; a new freezer; a display fridge; and two new barbecue sets

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is married with eight children. Two of her children are aged 16 and 17. Her husband is a carpenter while Rosario is engaged in a fishing business. This is her source of income for 28 years now. She is asking a loan of 25000 PHP to buy plywood, fishing nets, floaters, nylon and nails. These materials will be used to make a new fishing boat. Rosario hope to make the most of her business with this additional capital. In the future, she dreams of making her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy plywood, fishing nets, floaters, nylon and nails

loans.name: Brenda Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Brenda es una mujer muy luchadora vive junto a su esposo e hijos en una comunidad muy productiva al sur de nuestro país.
Doña Brenda Su negocio es la compra y venta de gallinas esto lo hace desde su casa de habitación y muchas veces se traslada a distintas comunidades cercanas a la suya a vender con la ayuda de su esposo. 
Doña Brenda con el préstamo espera comprar más gallinas y tela metálica para así arreglar el gallinero y así ningún animal pueda comerlas. Espera que esta inversión le permita obtener las ganancias suficientes para seguir apoyando a su familia.
Doña Brenda uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.

Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Brenda is s fighter who lives together with her husband and children in a very productive community in the south of our country. Brenda's business is buying and selling chickens which she does from her house. She often goes out to the different neighboring villages to sell with the help of her husband.

Brenda hopes to buy more chickens with the loan and metal wire to fix up the chicken coop so that animals can't eat them. She hopes that this investment allows her sufficient income to continue supporting her family. One of Brenda's dreams is for her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 38 years old,married and has six children, five attend school. 

She has raised pigs for 10 years and requests 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 19 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

She will save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 43-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is a mother for three sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker, where he gets a low and unstable income. Rajaa and her husband have a farm where they plant olive trees. The whole family cooperates together in the farm work. 

Rajaa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive seedlings for her farm. By taking this loan, Rajaa will be able to increase the farm productivity, and also, her income will increase. 

Rajaa appears in the photo at the family farm.

loans.use: to buy more olive seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a 40-year-old married woman with four children, three attend school.  She is a hard-working entrepreneur.

Adelaida has has a dried fish business or 12 years and requests 13,000 PHP amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Kanaiym

texts.ru: Канайым, 56 лет, замужем, образование - средне-специальное. У Канайым 6 детей, на протяжении 10 лет она занимается разведением скота и полеводством, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, также на 1,60 Га земли выращивает ячмень. Канайым хочет увеличить поголовье скота, поэтому она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS), она планирует приобрести теленка и овец. В будущем, Канайым хочет построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Kanayim is 56 years old and married. She has secondary education. Kanayim has six children. For a period of ten years she has worked with breeding livestock and field crop cultivation. Currently she has four cows, ten sheep and also 1.60 hectares of land where she grows barley. 

Kanayim would like to increase the number of livestock. Therefore she turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS). She plans to purchase a calf and some sheep. In the future, Kanayim would like to build a livestock barn.

loans.use: to purchase a calf  as well as additional sheep in order to increase the headcount of livestock

loans.name: Sabirakan

texts.ru: Сабиракан, 47 лет, замужем, есть сын и 2 дочери. У Сабиракан- среднее образование, 15 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Сабиракан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 2 лошади и 15 овец. Также имеется земельный надел, мерою 2,60 ГА, где Сабиракан выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). Сабиракан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и овец. Доходы от кредита позволят Сабиракан развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Sabirakan is 47 years old, married and has one son and two daughters. Sabirakan has secondary education. She has worked with agriculture for 15 years, supporting her family with additional income. 

Thanks to Sabirakan's persistent work, her farm currently has three cows, two horses and 15 sheep. She also has a plot of land of 2.60 hectares, where she grows barley. The monthly income is 9,000 som (KGS).

Sabirakan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a calf and sheep. The income from the loan will allow Sabirakan to develop her business and improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep and one calf for fattening up and reselling

loans.name: Ana Orbelina

texts.es: Ana, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de Trujillo, Colon. Ana, Lleva un año de haber decidido por poner su propio negocio donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, harina, manteca, productos de limpieza, pan, churros, refrescos, condimentos, huevos, y otros abarrotes. Con el propósito de incrementar el inventario ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, jabón, azúcar, harina, verduras, pan, churros, refrescos, huevos, papel higiénico, condimentos etc. considera que tendrá mas productos e incrementara las ventas. su meta es lograr que sus hijos se gradúen.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old, and she is married with 3 children.  She lives in the municipality of Trujillo, Colón.  A year ago, Ana decided to open her own business selling basic grains, sugar, flour, butter, cleaning products, bread, churros, soft drinks, condiments, eggs, and other groceries.

With the goal of increasing her inventory, she has decided to request a loan of 20,000 Lempiras ($950), in order to purchase basic grains, soap, sugar, flour, vegetables, bread, churros, soft drinks, eggs, toilet paper, condiments, etc.  

She believes that she will have more products and increase her sales.  Her goal is for her children to graduate.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, soap, sugar, flour, vegetables, bread, churros, soft drinks, eggs, toilet paper, condiments, etc. in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has had a dried fish business for 17 years.

She requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa, tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y tamales, de ella dependen económicamente un hijo y un nieto de 26 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, sale a vender todos los días, de ocho de la mañana a una de la tarde, al terminar la venta hace los preparativos para el día siguiente continuar desarrollando su negocio.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar maíz, aceite, pollo, condimentos, etc., adquirirá materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas y tamales, espera mejorar la calidad, productividad y ventas para tener mejores recursos económicos con los que pueda responder a las necesidades de su familia y cancelar su deuda.
Su visión es dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia, mejorar su negocio y mantener clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Rosa has a business selling tortillas and tamales. One son and one grandson, who are 26 and 6 years old respectively, are economically dependent on her. She goes out to sell every day from 8 a.m. until 1 p.m. and when she finishes selling she carries out the preparations for the next day, to continue developing her business.

She will use the loan to buy corn, oil, chicken, condiments etc, to acquire raw material for the production and sale of the tortillas and tamales. She hopes to improve her quality, productivity and sales in order to have better economic resources with which she can meet her family's needs and cancel her debt.

Her vision is to give her family a better quality of life, improve her business and maintain satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, chicken, condiments etc, to acquire raw material for the production and sale of tortillas and tamales.

loans.name: Abdulwahidu

texts.en:
Abdulwahidu is a maize farmer from Kwakwa village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdulwahidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdulwahidu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Abdulwahidu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family. He hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Selvanus

texts.en: Selvanus comes from Nyabihoko and he is married with 5 children. He deals in cattle fattening and has taken a loan of 4m UGX to buy more cattle for fattening so that he can generate more profits. He hopes that getting more profits will help him to get a good shelter for his family because they still live in a hut. He is hard working and thanks UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for the good job.

loans.use: to buy baby cows for fattening

loans.name: Sokoeurl's Group

texts.en:
Sokoeurl, 32, lives with family members in a rural village of the Siem Reap province. She is a mother of three children, two attend school and one is too young. She has grown rice to support her family for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. 

This is Sokoeurl's  second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She is the group leader and will spend her loan portion to pay the harvesting fee. 

She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria, es una mujer emprendedora y siempre busca la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante, en ayuda de su esposo quien la apoya con los gastos del hogar, ella tiene como negocio la venta de Calzado de segunda, y solicita este crédito para la compra de pacas de Zapatos ya que quiere aprovechar la fecha alta en compra para ganar un poco mas de dinero e invertir en su hogar quien también le esta realizando mejora, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Maria is an enterprising woman and always seeks a way to get her children ahead. To help her husband, who also supports her with the household expenses, she has as a business selling second-hand shoes. She asks for this loan to purchase bundles of shoes since she wants to take advantage of the high shopping season to earn a bit more money and invest in her home which she is also repairing. She is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have offered her.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of shoes.

loans.name: Cory

texts.en: Cory is twenty-eight years old. She is a food vendor at Tuguegarao. She lives with her mother, niece and sisters. She cooks food such as snacks and daily meals. She sells them at a small stall near their house. Cory asked for a loan to buy meat, fish and vegetables to cook and sell. She wanted to continue selling delicious meals and gain good profits to save for future use. She also wants to renovate her stall someday.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish and vegetables to cook and sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a fifty-six-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has two dependents. Helen owns a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. She also has an iron scrap business which is used in making bolo knives. This is the source of her income for the past fifteen years now. Helen is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, bread, biscuits, soap, toiletries, cooking oil, condiments and iron scraps for making bolo knives. With this loan, she will be able to improve her stocks. This will allow her to sell more to her customers and buyers. In the future, Helen hopes to make her business more productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, bread, biscuits, soap, toiletries, cooking oil,  condiments and iron scraps

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 24 years old and has two children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rubilyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rubilyn has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sack of rice grains to sell.

Sally has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sack of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a widow who works hard to support her family. She has had a food vending business for 10 years.

She requests  29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Naomi, 29 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Koibatek, a remote village in Kapsowar. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years, and she has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and to make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Koibatek area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi, via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en: Nim, 39, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Speu province and is a mother of five children. She can earn income to support her family condition via rice cropping. Moreover, she raises pigs and chickens to earn extra income. She has involved this business for ages and earns about 35,600 KHR per day. This is Nim's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living in a good health.

loans.use: To buy a decent latrine.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon is a 50-year-old a local farmer living in Battambang province. She has one child. She grows rice, works for others for a fee and raises cows to earn an income. She has involved this business for ages and earns her about 33,200 KHR per day. 

This is Lon's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan. She will spend her loan portion to pay her daughter's tuition fee.  Her daughter  wants to pursue a bachelor's degree  in Management and Tourism. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Nang is a 45-year-old woman with four children who lives in a rural area in Battambang province. 

She grows rice as a single source of her income. This is her fifth loan cycle  with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has successfully repaid her previous loans which helped to gradually improve her living conditions. 

She leads a group of three to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and seed. She hopes that she can get a good yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed.

loans.name: Bimayram

texts.en:
Bimayram is a strong woman. She was born in 1951. She is a widow with five children. She has been a widow since 1996 and it is hard keeping a family. 
Bimayram became an emigrant, working abroad for the benefit of her family. Independently she saw all her children get married. 

Recently she works as security in a supermarket. She wants to buy a heater and enclose her balcony with glass. She needs financial support for making her house better for winter.

loans.use: To buy a heater and making with glass her balcony

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Iloilo, Philippines. Irene earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Irene has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Irene wants to take a loan to buy additional merchandise for resale such as canned goods, noodles, rice, condiments, soap and shampoo, detergents, cooking oil, bread and biscuits, soft drinks and beverages. With this, she will be able to improve her stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers and buyers. 
Irene's future plans include the expansion of her store and for the continuous schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise for resale such as canned goods, noodles, rice, condiments, soap and shampoo, detergents, cooking oil, bread and biscuits, soft drinks and beverages

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia en compañía de sus dos hijos en edades de 16 y 10 años de edad, no cuenta con ayuda económica del extranjero,  para poder a subsistir con su familia se dedica a elaborar tortillas, tamales de pollo, cerdo y pisques, ella sola atiende a sus clientes, es una persona que con su experiencia ha logrado mantener el negocio activo.
Ella comprara materiales de construcción para hacer mejoraras en el local en que elabora y vende sus productos, dará mejor vistosidad a su negocio y sus clientes tendrán comodidad, espera recuperar la inversión con un mayor margen de ganancias que utilizara en el pago de la deuda y costear los gastos familiares.
Los proyectos son mantener su negocio, minimizar las necesidades familiares y que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own house in the company of her two children, ages 10 and 16. She does not receive any economic help from abroad; in order to support her family, she makes tortillas as well as chicken, pork and bean tamales. She works alone. Thanks to her experience, she has managed to maintain an active business. 

She will purchase construction materials to make improvements to her business space, increasing the visual appeal and making her customers more comfortable. She hopes to make a good return on the investment with a larger profit margin, which she will use to pay her debt and the living expenses of her family. Her plan is to keep her business going and reduce her family's needs. She hopes her children will become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make improvements to the shop in which she makes and sells her products, which will improve her business' appearance and her customers will be more comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy lead weights, floaters, fishing nets, nylon, rope and an engine

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 29 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of pearls business in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more pearls to sell.

Jenny has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pearl business for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Jenny aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more pearls to sell

loans.name: Eliada

texts.en:
Eliada is 33 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Eliada earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Eliada is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eliada has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from native bag making.

Eliada is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
At the tender age of 20, Ruth's passion for farming and education drove her to start practicing mixed farming. She is a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Nandihills area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpments. 

Ruth has been farming for the past 15 years. Over the years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practicing mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Ruth is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plough. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Nandihills area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Ruth could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Ruth, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Ruth believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Ruth to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 37 years old. She is married and has two children, age 15 and 17 years. Both of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Maria Edelmira

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a su hija mayor. Hace dos años que Maria, decidio tener su propia fuente de ingresos para obtener sus ingresos. Tiene un puesto de venta lo tiene en su casa y vende ropa como blusas, pantalones, vestidos, short, camisas y venta de artículos para el hogar y sandalias. Con el fin de aprovechar la temporada navideña a decidido solicitar un préstamo por 10,000 lempiras para surtir con camisas, jeans, short, blusas, vestidos, zapatos y sandalias. Tiene como meta mantener en crecimiento el negocio para vivir de él y ayudar a su hija.
texts.en: María is a 47 year old single mother of two children. She lives in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara, together with her oldest daughter. Two years ago Maria decided to have her own source of money so she could have income. She has a sales area in her house and she sells clothing like blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, shirts, household articles and sandals. With the goal of taking advantage of the Christmas season she has decided to request a loan of 10,000 HNL to stock up with shirts, jeans, shorts, blouses, dresses, shoes and sandals. Her goal is to continue to expand her business to live from it and help her daughter.

loans.use: to stock her business with jeans, shorts, blouses, dresses, shoes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Liberatha

texts.en:
Liberatha is 45 years old. She is married with 6 children, aged between 8 and 20 years, and all of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for 10 years now. With the loan requested from Kiva, she would like to buy more maize fertilizers. The profits from this business will be used to pay the school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more maize fertilizers

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 34 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. Rowena is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Rowena has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en: Nafiu is a maize farmer from Danju Gubuchi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nafiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to cater for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nafiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Nafiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and hopes to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia  is a married woman with six children from Talibon, Bohol. Four of her children attend school. She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fresh fish to the people in her community. She has been fishing for more than twenty years. To have an additional sources of income, Alicia engages in a food vending business. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing nets. With these, her profits will grow, as she will catch more fish. With the profits she earns, Alicia will be able to pay for her household expenses.

Alicia is hoping that she can handle her business well, so she can continue to support the schooling of her children and provide them with better shelter as well.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Fulvia

texts.es:
La  Sra. Fulvia es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 54 años , es soltera, con 4 hijos todas ya mayores y que trabajan de manera independiente.
Se dedica a las compras y ventas de menudencias y grasas en el Mercado, con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias comerciales y personales. Es una señora muy trabajadora, excelente cliente.
El cliente con este préstamo va comprar menudencias y grasas para la venta y así para tener mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Fulvia is from the city of Santaní, is 54 years old, single, with 4 children who are all adults and work on their own.

She works buying and selling offal and animal fats in the market, with a set customer base, good income, and good business and personal references. She is a hard-working woman, an excellent client.

The client will purchase offal and grease with this loan, to sell them, and in this way have more income.

loans.use: to purchase offal and grease to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is forty-three years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising cows.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is forty-nine years old and married with two children.  With one child in school, Susan works very hard to provide for her family.

Susan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs and chips.

Susan has been in this business for ten years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs and chips

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old, married and has six children, four who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Teresita requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins. Teresita has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is married and works hard to support her family with her clothing business.  Amelia has been in this business for 3 years.

Amelia requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy blouses, shorts, and  t-shirts to sell to her customers.

Amelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  blouses, shorts, and t-shirts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Resilda

texts.en:
Resilda is married and works hard to support her family through a herbal medicine business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 11 years and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is a 51-year-old man with six children from Kampong Cham province. He grows rice on two hectares area as a single source of income. He has been involved in this business for ages and earns 43,300 KHR per day. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he will spend his entire loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for harvesting. He hopes that he can earn more income and improve his farmland.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for harvesting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rodolfo Trinidad

texts.es: Rodolfo, tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside con su familia en un sector suburbano de Choloma, Cortes. Rodolfo siempre se ha dedicado al comercio vendiendo artículos del hogar y hace 4 años decidió poner el negocio de elaboración y venta de jugo de naranja. Este producto es vendido de manera ambulante en una carretilla, se ubica en puntos estratégicos de mayor movimiento de personas para vender sus jugos. Ha solicitado un prestamo por 10,000 lempiras para comprar materia prima como es naranja, bolsas, azúcar, agua, hielo, vasos y pajillas para la venta de jugos de naranja. El piensa que con las ganancias va poder invertir para vender otro tipo de jugos. Tiene como meta lograr la compra de su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 44 years old. He is married with 3 children and lives with his family in a suburban area of Choloma, Cortes. Rodolfo has always worked in trade, selling household items, and 4 years ago he decided to start a business making and selling orange juice. He sells this product on the street with a cart, which he sets up in strategic locations where there is a lot of people traffic to sell his juice. 

He has applied for a loan of 10,000 lempiras to buy raw material such as oranges, bags, sugar, water, ice, glasses and straws for the sale of orange juice. He thinks that with his earnings he will be able to invest in order to sell other types of juices. His goal is to be able to buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as oranges, bags, sugar, water, ice, glasses and straws for the sale of orange juice.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of his group. John is representing his group of twelve farmers in Webuye District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

John has been a farmer for more than twenty years and, in order to earn enough to feed his family, decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. His loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which he is very happy to be getting. This is because he will now have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this coming season, John is planning to send his children to school.

A total of 5.75 acres will be planted by John's Group, and between them they will receive a total of thirteen solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Ediza Mae

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ediza Mae works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a personal products retail business. Ediza Mae is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Ediza Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Sokunthea, 45, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one attends university and  one is in school. She grows peppers and earn extra income selling groceries. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she will use it to to pay for her son's tuition.  He wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in engineering. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's  tuition.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: На фотографии Шахло. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем. В браке у нее четверо детей. Шахло занимается продажей тканей, постельного белья и разной одежды. Шахло покупает свой товар на рынке города Душанбе и занимается продажей у себя дома. Ее клиентами являются соседи, родственники и друзья. Шахло эту деятельность продвигает уже четвертый год. Шахло занимается этой деятельностью, потому что она любит свою работу и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Растут дети, растут и их расходы. Шахло решила расширить деятельность, чтобы увеличить доход и позволить семье новые экономические возможности. На заемные деньги она приобретет постельное белье и ткани.
texts.en:
In the photo you see Shahlo. She is 30 years old and married. She has four children from her marriage. Shahlo works with selling fabric, bed linen and various clothing. 

Shahlo purchases her goods at the market in Dushanbe and sells from her home. Her customers are neighbors, family and friends. Shahlo has had this business for four years. She continues to work with it because she loves it and it helps her husband support the family. When children grow, the cost of having them also grows. 

Shahlo decided to expand her business in order to increase the income and give her family new financial opportunities. For the loan amount she will purchase bed linen and fabric.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and bed linen

loans.name: Edgardo Enrique

texts.es: Edgardo de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la venta de productos para televisores desde hace varios años, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un muro en el lugar que muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de ladrillos, hierro, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Edgardo, age 40, lives in his own house along with his wife. He has been selling products for televisions for several years. 

He wants to improve his home by constructing a wall in the space that is shown in the photograph, but he can’t accomplish it with what he earns, and that is the reason he is requesting a loan.  It is for the purchase of bricks, iron, cement, and sand, and to pay for labor, so that he and his family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, cement, and sand, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer de 26 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7y 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de golosinas.
Ella es generosa, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, buena madre, emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza enla zona de la ‘Mutualista’ un área caracterizada por ser el centro comercial de la ciudad, donde se agrupan oficinas y comercios de todo tipo. De clima cálido, tropical y húmedo con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el año. 
Nancy es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo lacio, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos; los mayores estudian en la escuela, el hijo menor juega todo el día. La familia vive en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas por menor de forma ambulante. Haga frio o haga calor, cada día de la semana ella debe cumplir su recorrido y su cuota de ventas diarias, ronda escuelas, oficinas, comercios, una y otra vez ofreciendo golosinas como; chocolates, chicles,  caramelos, galletas y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante y a toda hora. “Las golosinas son una verdadera tentación para grandes y chicos. Los padres deben ser muy estrictos en su consumo porque, aunque sea difícil negarle un caramelo a un niño, el abuso puede ser muy perjudicial para su salud. Y los grandes también deben cuidarse de comer demasiados dulces...” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio fijo. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de variedad de golosinas para surtir su negocio, ampliar su oferta y aprovechar las ventas de fin de año. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Nancy solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de golosinas para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nancy is a 26-year-old woman, lives with her partner, has 3 children, ages 10, 7, and 2, and her business is selling sweets. 

She is generous, understanding, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, a good mother, enterprising, responsible and hardworking. She does her business in the "Mutualista" zone, an area characterized as being the commercial center of the city, where there are many offices and businesses of all sorts. The climate is warm, tropical, and humid with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade during the whole year. 

Nancy has olive skin, is short-statured, has long straight black hair, her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her children; the oldest two are in school, the younger son plays all day.  The family lives in a rented house made of brick which has drinking water, electricity and sewer services. Her business is selling sweets in small amounts as a street vendor. Hot or cold, every day of the week, she has to complete her rounds and her daily quota of sales.  She goes to schools, offices, businesses, again and again offering sweets such as chocolates, gum, caramels, cookies and others. She does this work every day of the week as a street vendor and at all hours. "Sweets are a real temptation for people old and young. Parents should be very strict about their consumption because, although it is difficult to deny a child a caramel, the abuse could be very dangerous for their health. Adults should also be careful about eating too many sweets..." she says. 

Her dream is to have a permanent business. She wants to expand her business by purchasing a variety of sweets to stock her business, expand her offerings and for these reasons, Nancy is requesting a loan to purchase a variety of sweets to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of sweets to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is 24 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has two children who are doing study. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for three years. He is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. 

He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes. Anila is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. 

He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. 

Anila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband in buying clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and a single mother of two children. She also supports three members of her family. 

She is a farmer, and from the sale of the farm produce she is able to provide for her family’s needs. 

She has been in her farming business for two years and right now she makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She will be using this loan to buy seeds and agrochemicals for use in her farm. 

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be successful in her farming and be able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and agrochemicals for use in her farm.

loans.name: Claudia Estela

texts.es:
La señora Claudia es una mujer muy responsable vive con su esposo e hijo en una comunidad de la zona al Sur de nuestro país.
Doña Claudia su negocio es la elaboración y venta de  tortillas es muy conocida por los trabajadores de las distintas camaroneras de la zona y personas vecinas de su comunidad.
Doña Claudia con el préstamo espera comprar maíz, cal y leña,  para poder elaborar su producto y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes ya que tiene mucha demanda de su parte.
Espera poder ver el crecimiento de su negocio con las ganancias obtenidas  y a su vez desea mejorar su vivienda con y poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida para a hijos. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Claudia is a very responsible woman who lives with her husband and son in a community in the South of our country. Claudia's business is making and selling tortillas. She is well known by the workers in the shrimp industry of the area and neighbors in her community. Claudia hopes to buy corn, lime and wood with the loan to be able to make her product and fulfill the needs of her clients as there is a lot of demand. She hopes to see her business grow with the profits she gets and at the same time she would like to improve her house and provide a higher quality of living for her children.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and wood for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic furniture, utensils, a cauldron, etc. for her husband's small restaurant.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona maize farmer. 

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his  maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked about his goals, Yusuf expressed a desire to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and in the long run, make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating the pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 57 years old.  She actively participates in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably with a decent house and applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks.

 In the future, Carmen wants to see all her children finish their studies and have stable careers.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the fast-selling fruits like mangoes, pineapple, oranges, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio tiene 37 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Amancio se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, etc con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, él solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Amancio piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Amancio is 37 years old, his legal status is married, he has 2 children, and lives with his family in a rural zone in the district of Oyotún, in Chiclayo province, LAmbayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. His community works basically in agriculture, raising animals, and in trade. 

Amancio works raising and selling animals such as ducks, hens, roosters, chickens [for cooking], pigs, etc., with more than 10 years of experience in the business. The business is located in his home. He asks for a loan to purchase more animals. This investment will serve him to have more variety and productivity in animals, with a big impact on his business. Amancio plans to increase his stock of animals to be able to meet the range of tastes and needs of the customers in the area. This will allow him, in the short term, to improve his income, increase his earnings, with the end to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 42 años de edad, es casado, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Pucará, ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

El se dedica a la venta de insumos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 04 años y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, entre otros, para aumentar el stock de su negocio, con esto Rafael espera satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, lo que le permitirá obtener un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in the district of Pucará, located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in the district is quiet, with the inhabitants working primarily in agriculture, ranching, and commerce.

Rafael works in the sale of basic goods such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and others. His business is located in his home. He has been doing this work for four years and has very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan will be used to purchase a larger quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and others in order to increase his stock. With this, Rafael hopes to meet the needs and desires of his customers, which will allow him to earn more money and therefore improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of products such as rice, sugar, oil, and more, to increase his stock.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is married and has had a dried fish vending business for 5 years.  She requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Rona would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is married and has had a food vending business for 5 years.  Rosalie works hard to support her family and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy sugar, milk, and flour.

In the future, she would save enough money to provide a secure future for her family

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, and flour.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is fifty-five years old and married with two children.

Luzminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Luzminda has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an additional income from pig fattening.

Luzminda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for five years now, In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional rice grains to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy aditional rice grains to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 39 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Lucena works very hard to provide for them.

Lucena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Lucena has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina lives in Koibatek village, situated in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, near Eldoret town. Land in Koibatek is extremely fertile for agriculture. Most families in Koibatek practice agriculture. Christina and her husband own a small piece of land in this region. They live together with their two children. They have been doing dairy farming for the last six years to earn a living. Her primary income source is milk. 

Christina is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. As her children grow older, the upkeep and educational expenses keep rising. In order to meet these needs, Christina needs to boost her milk production to earn more income. With your loan, she will be able to afford a high-yielding dairy cow. She will use the additional income from milk sales to pay the loan installments and, later on, school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Este es el cuarto crédito que Doña Maria solicita para seguir trabajando y brindándole a sus clientes la mejor atención con la infraestructura adecuada. Esta vez solicita otro crédito para comprar cerdos en pie y leña al por mayor. Esta agradecida con los prestamos ya que aprovecha las ofertas de ventas leña así como se los brindan en los  momentos oportunos y de gran necesidad.
texts.en:
This is the fourth loan María has requested so she can keep on working and giving her customers the best service with appropriate infrastructure.

She's requesting another loan now to buy live pigs and firewood wholesale.

She's grateful for the loans because she makes the most of sales on firewood, and because they're offered at opportune moments and times of great need.

loans.use: to buy live pigs and firewood wholesale

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Gladys, a farmer from Koibatek, a remote village in Kapsowar, Kenya who has defied the common thinking among most Kenyans that agriculture is only for the older generation. Gladys’s primary source of income is milk, but she also raises tomatoes on her farm which she's named “ever blazing farm”. Gladys also engages in other personal business and has been able to earn a handsome profit from the venture. 

Gladys practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge from all the agricultural training she has been attending to broaden her skills. She sells her vegetables, eggs, and milk at the nearby market. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very thankful that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family, and she has always yearned to have more dairy cows. 

Gladys is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. She has already identified the breed of cow that she will buy. The cow will produce between 15-20 liters of milk per day. This breed produces milk referred to as “the ideal drinking milk” because it has all the required quantities of fat and protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production on Gladys' farm which will translate into more sales and better income for her and her family. Because of the potential for high milk production, Gladys will save more money to fully repay the loan. Gladys also believes that through the careful selection and application of strict standards of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standard.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Flordeline

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Flordeline works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns  income from buying and selling rice and charcoal. 

Flordeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new one for PHP 18000 to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Flordeline hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Sanabarhon

texts.ru: Санабархон 40 лет, замужем, есть 7 детей. У Санабархон - среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1992 году, благодаря упорному труду Санабархон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 7 лошадей и земельный надел мерою 0,14 ГА собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли. Также Санабархон занимается торговлей в маленьком павильоне. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Санабархон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку жеребцов. Доходы от кредита Санабархон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Sanabarhon is 40 years old, married and has seven children. Sanabarhon has secondary education. As an additional income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this in 1992. 

Thanks to Sanabarhon's persistent work, her farm currently has four cows and seven horses. She also has a plot of land of 0.14 hectares and rents 1.0 hectares of land. Sanabarhon also works with retail sales from a small pavilion. The monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Sanabarhon turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase foals. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase some foals in order to increase the headcount of horses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Lawal joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Matayas, Inusa and Lami.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Lawal would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Lawal can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Lawal  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure that his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Walter Jonathan

texts.es:
WALTER DE 24 AÑOS DE EDAD, CASADO CON TRES HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD Y ESTUDIAN EN PRIMARIA.  ES ORIGINARIA DE LEÓN, LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA DE OCCIDENTE, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLE, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL,  POR TAL MOTIVO LUCHA DÍA DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO Y A SU FAMILIA HACIENDO QUE EL NEGOCIO CRESCA Y PROPORCIONARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES ECONÓMICA A  SU FAMILIA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA Y SEGUNDA MANO  Y ZAPATOS, COSMÉTICOS. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN  Y LO DESEMPEÑA DESDE HACE CINCO AÑOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU MERCADERÍA CON: PACAS DE ROPA DE BUENA CALIDAD, PANTALONES, SHORT, FALDAS, BLUSAS, ROPA DE CAMA, ROPA DE NIÑO ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. WALTER AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Walter is 24 years old and is married with three younger children who study in primary school.  He is originally from León, a place that is located in western Nicaragua.  He characterizes himself as a worker, responsible, and with a desire for personal improvement. For this reason he fights every day to get ahead in his business and for his family. By doing increased business he provides better economic conditions for his family.

Owing to his desire to succeed economically, he sells new and used clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.  The business is located in his house and he has operated it for five years.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on merchandise like bales of good quality clothing, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, sheets, children's clothing, etc. so that in the near future he can achieve higher income. Walter is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to low income people to make a living in poor countries, like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up on products like bales of good quality clothing, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, sheets, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Dios Con Nosotros. Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL DIOS CON NOSOTROS ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO INTEGRANTES SEIS MUJERES DOS HOMBRES, MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE QUINCE HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO. SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SU RESPONSABILIDAD, TRABAJADORES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL TODOS SE CONOCEN ENTRE SI Y TIENEN DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS. EL CUAL LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA OBTENER GANANCIAS YA QUE ES EL MEDIO DE SUBSISTENCIA DE SUS FAMILIAS.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE  LA COORDINADORA ES MERCEDES  Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD LA VENTA DE REFRESCOS NATURALES DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y  EN SU CASA DE HABILITACIÓN, ELLA DEDICA   A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS DESDE LA PREPARACIÓN DE LAS FRUTAS Y ELBARACION DEL REFRESCOS NATURALES  Y SU VENTA, ACTIVIDAD QUE LA DESEMPEÑA CON MUCHO GUSTO YA QUE ES EL SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES COMPRAR FRUTAS Y DEMÁS MATERIALES PARA LA PREPARCION DE LOS MISMO COMO: PAPAYA, PIÑA, NARANJAS, SANDIAS, MELÓN, LECHE, VAINILLA, CACAO, AZÚCAR, BOLSAS, VASOS ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS Y MANTENER  Y HACER CRECER SU CLIENTELA. DIOS CON NOSOTROS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN  A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Dios con Nosotros communal bank group is made up of eight members, six women and two men, mothers and fathers responsible for fifteen young children, who are students. They are from Maplaisillo, and are characterized as responsible and hardworking, with desires to better themselves. They all know each other and have different work, with which they struggle day by day to get earnings since it is the means of subsistence for their families.  

Thanks to her desires to get ahead, the coordinator is Mercedes and she works selling natural drinks as a street vendor and in her house. She works in her business for some twelve hours every day, from the preparation of the fruit, making the natural drinks, and her sales, work that she does with pleasure since it is the sustenance for her family. The purpose of the loan is to purchase fruit and other materials for making these such as papayas, pineapples, oranges, watermelon, melon, milk, vanilla, cocoa, sugar, bags, glasses, etc. so that in a not-so-distant future she can get more income and maintain and increase her customer base. Dios con Nosotros is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited economic resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in fruits and other materials to sell natural drinks such as papayas, pineapples, oranges, watermelon, melon, milk, vanilla, cocoa, sugar, bags, glasses, etc.

loans.name: Rina Lyn

texts.en:
Rina Lyn is 32 years old from Carles, Iloilo, Philippines. She is married with five children, who are between the ages of four and eleven.

She is engaged in running a sari-sari (variety) store business and fishing for five years now. Rina Lyn would like to improve her inventory level and buy items in bulk for a better profit. She is asking for a loan of 30000 PHP to buy crude oil, gasoline, canned goods, candies, chips, toiletries, seasoning and condiments.

She hopes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to increase her income for her family. She also dreams of being a successful parent by sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, gasoline, canned goods, candies, chips, toiletries, seasoning and condiments

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 52 years old. She is married to Mutua and together they have been blessed with six children. Three of them are currently in school.

Christine sells groceries and fruits, a business she has done for the last eight years earning a monthly income of KES 9,800.
