Christine has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000 which she will use to add stock of fruits in season; these are mangoes and plums. She will also be able to add stock of leafy green vegetables.

With the anticipated profits, Christine will be able to open a kiosk for her husband. Her hope and dream for the future is to become self-reliant.

loans.use: to add stock of mangoes and plums in season, plus leafy green vegetables

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson comes from Kitwe cell in Nyabihoko. He is 28 years old, married, and has two children.

He has two businesses: a veterinary drug shop and a bar. The main business is the veterinary drug shop. He requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to help him run his business smoothly. He will buy more stock of veterinary drugs to sell. 

His challenge is that he still rents premises both for business and home, which increases his costs. His hope is that after getting enough profits he will construct a house for his family to house them decently. He is hardworking and resilient.

loans.use: To buy veterinary drugs to sell.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is 41 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are in school

Feliciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 19 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. 

Feliciana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Feliciana has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Feliciana aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mylard

texts.en:
Mylard is 31 years old and lives in Map-an, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents. 

As his main source of income, Mylard has been engaged in a bakeshop business for more than 4 years already. He earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month from doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in purchasing 2 sacks of flour and 1 sack of sugar for his bakeshop. Mylard has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. 

In the future, Mylard hopes to expand his bakeshop business by opening an additional branch in the nearby town.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing 2 sacks of flour and 1 sack of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her mamalishe (local cafe) stock and serve more people

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of seven grown-up children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a businesswoman. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Aida has been in the business for more than  15 years now.  

Aida is asking to take out a loan to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, noodles and canned goods, condiments, beverages, and others. With a loan, Aida will be able to improve her stock thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Aida wants to expand her store so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell such as rice, bread and biscuits, soap and toiletries, noodles and canned goods, condiments, beverages, and others

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.es:
Doña Encarnación al igual que sus hijos, nietos y esposo viven juntos en un caserío en la zona sur de nuestro país son muy conocidos por sus vecinos como personas responsables y sobre todo muy humildes.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa americana y ropa nueva esto lo hace ambulante, vende su mercadería en los días de pago en las diferentes camaroneras de la zona. Sus hijas le ayudan también.
Con el préstamo espera comprar pantalones, aretes, camisas,  faldas, etc. ya que  los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes son muchos y no da abasto con el producto que tiene y así gracias a esta inversión espera poder darle mejor calidad a sus hijos y  obtener mejores ganancias.
En un futuro espera tener una tienda de ropa americana.

Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Encarnación lives with her children, grandchildren, and husband in a village in southern Honduras. They are very well-known by their neighbors as responsible and above all, humble, people.

She sells American clothing and new clothing on the streets on pay days at the various shrimp farms in the area. Her daughters help her also.

She plans to use the loan to buy pants, earrings, shirts, skirts, etc. because her customers have given her many orders but she doesn't have enough product to fill them. Thanks to this investment she hopes to increase her earnings and be able to give her children a better quality of life. In the future she hopes to have an American clothing store

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy pants, earrings, shirts, skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lauagaia

texts.en:
Lauagaia is a 27 year old mother with 3 children. She owns and operates a small business selling taro and banana chips in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years.

Lauagaia has requested a loan to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags and vegetable oil to help her run the business. She will use her profit to build a small convenience store in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy a sack of taro, bananas, a frying pan, plastic bags and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Gani

texts.ru: Гани мужчина 45 лет , женат ,отец троих детей. С детства он занимается животноводством ,помогал родителям ухаживать за домашним скотом,выращивал овощи и фрукты ,помогал в  воспитании братьев и сестер. Гани хотел получить высшее образование и работать в офисе , но его мечта не осуществилась ,потому что у его родителей не было средств ,чтобы оплатить его образование.После женитьбы Гани продолжил заниматься животноводством.Сейчас у него есть собственный участок земли,где он и разводит свой скот.Он работает  ради будущего своих детей,чтобы они ни в чем не знали нужд.Гани хочет взять кредит для закупки корма для скота на зиму,но ему не хватает денег.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется не его просьбу о помощи и выделит ему нужную сумму.
texts.en:
Gani is a man of 45 years. He is married and the father of three children. Since childhood he has worked with livestock breeding, helping his parents look after the livestock, growing vegetables and fruit and raising his brothers and sister. 

Gani wanted to get higher education and work at an office, however his dream did not come true because his parents did not have enough money to pay for his education. After getting married, Gani continued to work with livestock breeding. He has his own plot of land on which he keeps his livestock. He works for his children's future, so that they will be in need of anything. 

Gani would like to take a loan to purchase livestock fodder for the winter, but he does not have enough money. Therefore he turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. He hopes that "MDO Arvand" will respond to his request for help and give him the necessary amount.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder

loans.name: Luz Naira

texts.es: Luz es una emprendedora mujer de 33 años de edad, se encuentra domiciliada en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, donde funciona su taller de confecciones.  Desde muy joven le gustó la confección de ropa, por ello estudió este arte y  a partir del año 2012 empezó a ejercer su profesión.  Su producción va dirigida a almacenes, a los cuales les ofrece facilidad de pago, ella trabaja con mucho sacrificio y dedicación de lunes a sábado en el horario de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m., para cumplir con los pedidos que le generan sus clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual comprará insumos como hilos, telas, botones, cremalleras y estas compras las realizará de contado a almacenes mayoristas.  Ella necesita capital de trabajo para mejorar su producción, porque su flujo de caja es muy lento y  tiene que esperar que los proveedores le paguen para reinvertir. Su principal desafío con el que ha tenido que luchar, ha sido el escaso capital de trabajo pero ella ha logrado mantenerse  en el mercado. Su gran meta para el negocio es abrir un taller más grande, razón para dedica 12 horas diarias a su negocio y poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija de 8 años de edad y al resto de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is an enterprising 33 year old woman. She lives in a neighborhood in the south west of Barranquilla where she has her sewing workshop. Since she was young she has liked sewing clothing so she studied this art and in 2012 started to practice her trade. Her production goes to stores whom she offers ease of payment. She works with much sacrifice and dedication from Monday to Saturday from 8 am to 8 pm to fulfill the orders from her clients.

Currently she is requesting a loan from Kiva, the first loan that she has had from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy supplies like thread, fabric, buttons and zippers. She will buy from wholesalers in cash. She needs working capital to improve her production because her cash flow is very slow and she has to wait for the distributors to repay her before she can reinvest.

Her main challenge that she has had to face is the lack of working capital but she has been able to keep herself in the market. Her big goal for her business is to open a larger workshop. This is the reason she dedicates 12 hours per day to her business. She also wants to provide a higher quality of living for her 8 year old daughter and the rest of her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like thread, fabric, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Beatrice. She lives in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills, carpeted in manicured mango plantations. Beatrice is the mother of three lovely children and she has been in the agriculture business for five years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and maize. 

Beatrice has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Beatrice remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Beatrice is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Beatrice will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will harvest better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Beatrice’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standard indirectly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a 29-year-old  married woman with two children, one child attends school.  Anabelle works very hard to provide for her family.

Anabelle has run a general store for 3 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stock items to sell in her general store.

She sells noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, and cooking oil. 

Anabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 44-year-old  married woman and has a general store.  She requests 4,600 PHP through NWTF to buy a solar lamp to  extend her business hours.

Rosalinda is aware that by using the solar lamp , she is  saving money,  helping the environment, and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lucia is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Lucia has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy supplies for her business such as thread, needles, etc. 

Lucia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business such as thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 35 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Ma. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Walayat

texts.en:
Walayat is 54 and the mother of six children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of vegetables. Therefore, Walayat asked for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help with her husband's vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 41 years old and married with two children who are both in school.

Luzviminda earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from native bag making.

Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Luzviminda is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough so that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, es una señora acompañada, tiene dos hijos de 25 y 20 años de edad, por iniciativa propia inicio a vender tortillas en el mercado municipal de la cuidad, lo hace todos los días y no tiene mucha competencia, de esta manera puede tener ingresos para apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Invertirá en maíz, leña, cal, gas propano, carnes, especias y otros materiales, seguirá elaborando la venta de tortillas y agregara la venta de tamales para tener mayores ingresos, sus proyecciones son tener mayor capacidad de pago para tener buena calificación crediticia.
Sus sueños son tener en un  futuro no muy lejano casa propia y que su familia viva en un mejor entorno.
texts.en:
Maribel is a woman with two children of ages 25 and 20 years old. On her own initiative, she started selling tortillas in the municipal market in town. She works everyday and does not have much competition. In this way she can make income to help pay for family expenses.

She will invest in corn, wood, lime, propane, meats, spices, and other materials. She will continue to develop her sale of tortillas and also add the sale of tamales to improve income. Her projections are to have greater capacity and to have better credit rating. Her dreams are to have her own home and a better environment for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to invest in corn, wood, lime, propane, meats, spices and other materials. She will continue to develop her sale of tortillas and also add the sale of tamales.

loans.name: Carlos Rigoberto

texts.es:
Carlos es casado, tiene 31 años de edad, el vive en una comunidad de Sololá, con una hermosa familia de 5 hijos, tres de ellos estudian en la comunidad donde él vive. 

Carlos para progresar con su familia, decidió hace diez años instalar una tienda de abarrotes, este oficio lo aprendió con amigos y familiares, previo a instalar su tienda,  Carlos trabajo como empleado en varias tienda de ahí obtuvo la experiencia.

La tienda de Carlos lo tiene fuera de la comunidad ya que en la comunidad donde él vive es pequeña, por tal razón el tomo esa decisión de ponerlo en otro lugar, Carlos con el apoyo de sus amigos y conocidos se le ha incrementado su negocio, él ahora necesita de un capital económico,  para poder comprar  más abarrotes a diferentes empresa, razón por la cual él está en búsqueda de un préstamo para que su tienda cada día se mas grande. 

Carlos quiere lograr su meta este año, las expectativas de él  es lograr el préstamo para hacer realidad su sueño, pues con las ganancias que genera, una parte invertirá en el pago del préstamo y otro parte para hacer un pequeño ahorro. Para que algún día pueda construir una casa ya que sus hijos cada día crecen y necesitan de un espacio cada uno.
texts.en:
Carlos, 31, is married.  He lives in a community in Sololá with his beautiful family of five children, three of whom attend school in the community where they live.

Ten years ago Carlos decided to start a grocery store so he could make progress with his family.  He learned the trade from friends and relatives.  Before starting his store Carlos worked as an employee in several stores, where he got his experience.

Carlos's store is outside his community because where he lives is small.  That's why he made the decision to put it in another place.  Carlos has expanded his business with the support of his friends and acquaintances.  Now he needs financial capital to be able to buy more groceries from different companies.  He's in search of a loan so his store will be bigger every day.

Carlos wants to achieve his goal this year.  His expectations are to get the loan and make his dream a reality.  With the profits he earns, he'll invest part in paying back the loan and part in savings so one day he can build a house.  His children are growing and they all need their own space.

loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe tiene 21 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hermano de 9 años de edad y su hija de 4 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, desde hace 4 años lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar, además apoyada también por su compañero de vida que le apoya gracias a que presta sus servicios de seguridad. Guadalupe desea construir un cuarto para la cocina y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto para la cocina en su vivienda.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 21 years old. She lives in her own house along with her life partner, her 9 year old brother, and her 4 year old daughter. She is a working woman who sells basic consumer goods in her home for the past 4 years. This has allowed her to sustain the economy in her home, also supported by her life partner who works as a security guard. Guadalupe wants to build a room for the kitchen, thus she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick and rebar to build a room for the kitchen in her home.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and rebar to build a room for the kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.en:
Ramazon is a handsome man. He was born in 1977.  He is married. He has four children. Ramazon and his wife are working baking bread. He is a hardworking man. Baking bread takes time and strength. Baked bread is sold in a domestic market. 

Ramazon is planning to build a roof for his house and needs financial support for making their place of living better.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic goods like salt, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and beverages. She is 33 year old, a married woman with children ages 13, 8 and 4 years old.  Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs to have supplemental income. Her husband works in construction as a mason. Together with her family, she lives in Talibon, Bohol.

Delia is asking for a loan to buy assorted stock for the store like soft drinks, canned goods, toiletries and beverages. This variety of goods will help attract more customers and eventually create high impact on sales. These will enable Delia to start to settle her obligations. She could then roll back her capital to any business ventures, thus making her livelihood improve.

Delia dreams that someday, she will be able to manage both business properly for the welfare of her children and to have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store like soft drinks, canned goods, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Yhovana

texts.es:
Yhovana es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera sin hijos y se dedica a la producción y venta de Queso.
Ella es una persona trabajadora, sencilla, humilde, honesta, perseverante, madrugadora, puntual, emprendedora y muy luchadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad de Batallas a una altura de 3735 metros sobre el nivel del mar, distante a 65 kilómetros de la ciudad de la paz.
Yhovana es de tez morena, cabello negro largo trenzado, estatura pequeña,  ojos obscuros, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta y pollera), su lengua natal es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su rutina comienza desde muy tempranas horas de la madrugada, incluso antes de que los gallos anuncien la alborada, en esta localidad de la zona del municipio de ‘Batallas’, trabajar el insumo lácteo hasta darle esa consistencia característica, es una tradición que es compartida por gran parte de los habitantes. Con pocas ganancias y bastante esfuerzo, diariamente lucha para sacar sus productos frescos a la calle, son muchos los gastos que tiene que hacer para llegar al producto final. El proceso comienza con la leche recién ordeñada, los envases para almacenar el queso se elaboran con materiales de Totora, propia del lugar. “Este trabajo nos da para vivir honradamente y sin lujos. Con lo que ganamos pagamos las cuentas, compramos comida y seguimos trabajando con el queso para comercializarlo..”, comenta Yhovana.
El principal problema de Yhovana es la poca producción de leche, la época lluviosa fue muy corta y no ayudó a que aumentara el pasto para alimentar a las vacas. Esto repercutió de manera directa en la obtención de la leche, la provisión diaria es insuficiente para aumentar la producción de queso, dependiendo de la época del año, el pasto desmejora y esto merma la producción de leche.
Es por esos motivos que Yhovana solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras, aumentar la producción de queso y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yhovana is a young woman, 22 years old, single, without children, who works making and selling cheese.

She is hardworking, simple, humble, honest, determined, an early riser, punctual, enterprising, and very persistent.  Her business is located in Batallas, at an altitude of 3735 meters above sea level, 65 kilometers from the city of La Paz.

Yhovana has olive skin, long braided black hair, is short, has dark eyes, and dresses traditionally (blanket and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]). Her native language is Aymara and she uses Spanish for business. Her routine starts very early in the morning, even before the roosters announce the dawn in this location in the municipal zone of Batallas. She works the dairy product until giving it this characteristic consistency. It is a tradition that is shared by many of the inhabitants. With little income and a lot of effort, she struggles daily to bring her fresh products to the street. The expenses to arrive at the final product are many. The process begins with the milk recently milked, the containers to store the cheese are made from totora reeds, typical of the region.  

"This work allows us to live honorably and without luxury. With what we earn, we pay the bills, purchase food, and continue working with the cheese to sell it..." says Yhovana. 

Yhovana's primary problem is low milk production. The rainy season was very short and didn't help to grow the grass to feed the cows. This had direct impact on the milk she gets. The dairy production is insufficient to increase the production of cheese. Depending on the season, the grass spoils and this reduces the milk production.

For these reasons, Yhovana is asking for a loan to purchase dairy cows, increase the production of cheese, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reyna  es una mujer luchadora y responsable vive junto a su esposo en una comunidad muy productiva al sur de nuestro país.
Doña Reyna su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos esto lo hace desde su casa de habitación y muchas veces se traslada a distintas comunidades cercanas a la suya venderlos esto con la ayuda de su esposo.
Doña Reyna con el espera  comprar más cerdos  para engordarlos y así venderlos a mejor precio en esta época navideña para obtener mejores ganancias con las ventas y también espera poder darles mejor atención a sus clientes.
Doña Reyna desea poder darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia esto con la compra de un terreno.

Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Reyna is a determined and responsible woman, she lives with her husband in a very productive community in he south of the country.
Reyna's business is buying and selling pigs and she does this from her home and often travels to different nearby communities to sell them with the help of her husband.
Reyna hopes to buy more pigs in order to fatten them up and then sell them for a better price at this Christmas time, in order to gain better profits with the sales and she also hopes to be able to give her customers better care.
Reyna wants to be able to give her family a better quality of life and buy some land.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business.

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en:
Leonie is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Iloilo, Philippines. Leonie runs a sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Leonie is a very hardworking woman. Aside from looking after her children, she also finds time to operate her small business. This is her source of income for more than 10 years now.

Leonie is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like rice, biscuits and chips, sugar, salt and vinegar, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings. This loan will help Leonie in increasing her store's inventory which will attract more buyers.

In the future, Leonie hopes of improving their way of living and make her business more profitable and stable.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell like rice, biscuits and chips, sugar, salt and vinegar, soft drinks and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and seasonings

loans.name: Bazarkul

texts.ru: Базаркул 49 лет, замужем, от брака имеет 4 детей, младшая дочь - школьного возраста. В настоящее время Базаркул занимается животноводством и полеводством, дети и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Базаркул имеет не только практический опыт в животноводстве, но и теоретические навыки. Она с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу. Ежегодно обрабатывает 2,40 га земли, выращивает ячмень. В своем хозяйстве Базаркул имеет 3 коровы, 1 лошадь и 12 овец. Базаркул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения доходов от продажи скота.
texts.en: Bazarkul is 49 years old, married and has 4 children from her marriage, with the youngest daughter of school-age. At the present time, Bazarkul is involved in animal husbandry and farming, and her children and husband help her with the business. Bazarkul not only has a practical experience in animal husbandry, but also theoretical knowledge. She treats her business with great responsibility. She annually treats 2.40 hectares of land and grows barley there. Bazarkul has 3 cows, 1 horse and 12 sheep on her farm. Bazarkul requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep in order to increase her income from selling livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep in order to increase her income from selling livestock

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 32 years old and married with one child in school; Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soft drinks, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Girlie has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soft drinks, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Mazhar Iqbal

texts.en:
Young and enthusiastic, Mazhar runs a Paint Shop in Karachi. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents. He is gaining more experience with time and is always keen to learn and improve his entrepreneurial skills.

Due to some personal reasons he could not continue his studies so he decided to start a business to earn a living. Since then he has been working hard to make his business a success. Taking on such a task at such a young age has made him organized and disciplined.

Mazhar wants to boost his sales by buying different varieties of paints in bulk quantities. For this purpose, he has requested a loan to get more established and improve his living standards.

He is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase paints in bulk quantities for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet in her home, to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for his furniture workshop

loans.name: Nientaga Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, les sept membres du groupe Nientaga ont en moyenne 37 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, draps, condiments et coco. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame  Bintou  (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse des draps de friperies de modèles différents. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de draps de friperie à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coura en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame  Bintou  compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Nientaga group are women who are all married in monogamous households. They average 37 years of age and five children each. They all live in Kalaban-coura, and they know one another as neighbors and through the income-generating activities they conduct in the village. They practice small trade involving bed sheets, condiments and coco.  

To bolster their working capital, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance organization. This is their second group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Bintou (standing at the far right in the group photo) is a major reseller of second-hand bed sheets in various styles. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bales of used bed sheets in Médine. She retails her stock as an itinerant vendor in Kalaban-coura to a clientele composed mainly of women.  

With this loan, Mrs. Bintou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 90,000FCFA, which she will use to provide for her household and to reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy second-hand bed sheets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products and pay for her cafe space lease

loans.name: Melva Lissette

texts.es: Doña Melva de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de uso personal desde hace varios años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: Melva, 35 years old. lives in her own house with her husband and her child.. She has worked selling clothing and personal care products for a number of years. Her business is located near her home and she has many customers. She is asking for a loan to purchase more products in bulk to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and personal care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 37 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, con carga familiar. Reside en casa propia junto a su nieta menor de edad, él es natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que su actividad es la agricultura, ganadería, comercio y transporte. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Segundo se dedica a la comercialización de aves de corral, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 3 años en el negocio, con clientela fija en la zona, Segundo realiza su actividad en su domicilio; él cuenta con muy buenas referencias en la zona. El destino del crédito será para mejora de sus vivienda, pues desea arreglar el techo de su vivienda dado que ya se acerca la temporada de lluvias y Segundo desea brindarles mayor seguirdad y comodidad a su familia para de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is 37 years old and he is common-law-married, with family responsibilities. He lives in his own house along with his granddaughter, who is a minor.  He was born in the area.  

Life in the community is tranquil, as the occupations there are agriculture, livestock-raising, and trade. It is located in the district and province of Morropón, within the region of Piura on Peru’s northern coast.

Segundo has been selling poultry for more than three years, and he has a steady clientele in the area. He works where he lives, and he has good references in the area.  

The loan will be for improving his home, as he wants to repair the roof because the rainy season is already drawing near.  Segundo wants to make his family more secure and comfortable, and in this way, improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn is a 31-year-old married mother of three children, ages 2, 8 and 9. She is a resident of Carles, Iloilo and has been in the business of fishing for 10 years now and she works hard to help support the family. Her husband also is a fisherman. The business is not always good, specially if the weather is not conducive to fishing like if there is typhoon or storm but they persevere for their family’s sake.  She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy a new boat engine. Roselyn hopes that she could expand her ventures and earn a bigger income so she can provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine

loans.name: Celestino Ferdinand

texts.en:
Celestino Ferdinand is 49 years old and is from Luna, Isabela. He is married and gifted with four children. With the little income they get from farming, he finds it difficult to send his son to college. His son Celestino III is taking up a BS in Radiology Technology. He wants to finish his studies to be successful and be able to help his parents, who worked hard to provide for their needs. He chose this course because this is in demand inside and outside the country. Studying is difficult, and what makes it more difficult is having financial difficulties. 

So to help him, Celestino wants to avail himself of a PHP 150,000 education loan from the Kiva lenders. He is hopeful that lenders will approve his loan so his son can continue pursuing his college degree.

loans.use: to pay for his son's tuition fee

loans.name: Apolonita

texts.en:
Apolonita works hard to support her family. Apolonita is married, and has a shell craft business in the Philippines.

Apolonita requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Apolonita has been in this business for six years now.

Apolonita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 72 years old, married and has 12 children.  

Magdalena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Magdalena has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 26 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Emmy, a 26-year-old farmer from a remote village in the Koibatek, Kapsowar area. She resides with her husband with whom she has been blessed with one lovely angelic-looking child. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells maize, milk, eggs and various varieties of food crops at the local market. She passionately loves poultry farming but the biggest challenge she is facing is lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Emmy is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. She believes the excess maize she has will be useful in feeding the poultry; sorghum will be used in giving the poultry energy, and green grams for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. 

Apart from an increase in egg output, Emmy will get increased output of poultry meat, and this will increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she is going to turn around her living conditions and live a better life. Other than profits, she is going to benefit from chicken manure which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will save more money that would have been spent in buying fertilizer. Your loan will bring joy to her family because she will be able to support her family and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Julieta has been in this business for 25 years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela es reside en un barrio de Barranquilla, es una mujer de 42 años de edad, ella siempre ha sido emprendedora en los negocios y desde su casa ha ideado un sin número de maneras de captar dinero,  hace ocho años empezó con una venta de cervezas puesto que su cónyuge y ella tenían dos enfriadores, luego compraron víveres, una vitrina para exhibir productos de papelería, detalles, y venden comidas  típicos de la región (productos de harina de maíz o yuca, rellenos carne, pollo, huevo, queso y que son freídos en aceite).  Además de estas actividades también vende jeans, calzado, camisas y conjuntos de niños, a sus vecinos del barrio en el que reside a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio con los nuevos modelos de jeans, calzado, camisas y conjuntos de niños, para aprovechar las fiestas en la que nos encontramos en los días de navidad. Adela, es madre de ocho hijas y tres hijos, ella desea que sus hijos sean independientes y logren consolidarse en un futuro promisorio. Ella tiene definida como meta de negocio a futuro hacer un local en su casa para mejorar la fachada de su negocio.
texts.en: Adela lives in a neighbourhood of Barranquilla. She is a 42-year-old mother. She has always been enterprising in business and has, from her home, come up with innumerable ways to make money. Eight years ago she started selling beer because she and her partner had two fridges. Later they would buy groceries and a display case to display stationery and other items. They sell food typical of the region (flour or corn or yucca products filled with meat, chicken, egg, and cheese fried in oil). On top of these activities she also sells jeans, shoes, shirts, and children's outfits to her neighbours. She offers easy payment options. She is currently applying for a loan which will be put on Kiva. It is her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Through it, she will stock her business with the new models of jeans, shoes, shirts, and children's outfits. She wants her children to be independent and to have a promising future. She has a defined future goal of turning part of her home into a store in order to improve her business' image.

loans.use: to stock her business with the new models of jeans, shoes, shirts, and children's outfits.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 52 years old and married with eight children, one in school..Vivian works very hard to provide for her family.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles, and canned goods.

Vivian has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, noodles,and  canned goods.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Айсулуу есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, 0,23 Га собственной и 0,80 Га арендованной земли, на которой она выращивает ячмень. Айсулуу продает экологически чистое молоко на ежедневной основе. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). Айсулуу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от проекта Айсулуу будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Aisuluu succesffully repaid her loan after using it as directed. She is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Aisuluu's farm contains 2 cows, 15 sheep, and 0.23 hectares of owned as well as 0.80 of leased land, where she grows barley. Aisuluu sells ecologically-clean milk on a daily basis. Her monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS). Aisuluu requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a cow. Aisuluu will use the earnings from this project into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin es una joven de 37 años, nació en la provincia Andrés Ibáñez del departamento de Santa Cruz de la Sierra – Bolivia, trabaja desde hace un año aproximadamente como profesional de apoyo en el departamento de Espacio Público de la Alcaldía Municipal de Santa Cruz.
Actualmente Evelin se encuentra culminando sus estudios en la carrera de Contaduría Pública en la Universidad Privada CUMBRE, para lo cual solicita un crédito educativo.
Evelin comenta que le ha sido difícil salir adelante, siendo su mayor obstáculo el factor económico, pero cuenta con un gran incentivo para seguir adelante que es su pequeña hija, por quien se esfuerza en ser mejor persona todos los días. 
Evelin manifiesta que una vez concluida su carrera, podrá postular a un mejor puesto de trabajo con mayor remuneración. Su sueño es crear su propia empresa y afirma que lo que la hace diferente a otros estudiantes es su determinación a superar las dificultades que se le presentan, luchando siempre con la convicción de alcanzar un mejor futuro para su pequeña hija.  
Evelin se siente muy contenta y agradecida por saber que hay personas que día a día ayudan a otros sin esperar nada a cambio y asimismo los alienta a seguir adelante hasta alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Evelin is 37 years old and was born in Andrés Ibáñez province, in Santa Cruz de la Sierra Department, Bolivia. She has been working as a support professional for about a year in the Department of Public Space in the Santa Cruz Municipal Government. Evelin is currently finishing up her studies in the field of Public Accounting at CUMBRE Private University, for which she is requesting an education loan. 

Evelin states that it has been difficult for her to get ahead, finances being her main obstacle. But she has a big incentive, her little daughter, for whom she  strives to be a better person every day. Evelin states that once she has finished her degree she will be qualified for a better job with a higher salary. Her dream is to create he own company and affirms that what sets her apart from her fellow students is her determination to overcome the difficulties she faces, always fighting with the conviction that she will achieve a better future for her little daughter.

Evelin is very content and grateful in the knowledge that there are people who help others every day, expecting nothing in return, which encourages them to keep on going until they achieve their dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her degree in Public Accounting.

loans.name: Shaiyrbyubyu

texts.ru: Шайырбюбю 58 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные. Шайырбюбю имеет среднее образование. По характеру она: честная и пунктуальная. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2004 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки одной лошади. Благодаря упорному труду Шайырбюбю в хозяйстве имеется: 5 коров, 2 лошади и 5 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шайырбюбю обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена помочь сыну в строительстве дома.
texts.en: Shaiyrbyubyu is 58 years old and married. All of her children are grown-up and self-sufficient. Shaiyrbyubyu has a secondary education. She is honest and punctual by nature. Her husband helps her with her business. As the main source of income for her family, she has been practicing livestock breeding since 2004. She started this business with the purchase of one horse. Thanks to Shaiybyubyu's hard work, she currently has 5 cows, 2 horses and 5 sheep on her farm. To further develop her business, Shaiyrbyubyu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her farm. She is also determined to help her son build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cows to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Cheun's Group

texts.en: Cheun’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Cheun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, madre de dos menores hijos, ella decidió  abrir su propio negocio en su casa, y de esta manera generar un ingreso más para solventar los gastos de su familia, pues su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, comida; la buena calidad y atención le permite contar con clientes fijos. Paralelo a este negocio se dedica en las tardes al servicio de taxi en su propio moto taxi. Por ello requiere del préstamo para el servicio de mantenimiento general a su moto taxi. Su mayor anhelo de Delia es ahorrar con el propósito de brindarles a sus hijos una carrera universitaria. 
Está muy contenta por el apoyo brindado por parte de Kiva
texts.en: Delia, mother of two minor children, decided to open her own business in her house, and in this way generate more income to cover her family's expenses. Since her efforts have managed to improve her business, she makes a living selling refreshments and food; the good quality and service allow her to count on regular clients. Parallel to this business she makes a living in the afternoons with a taxi service in her own mototaxi. For this she needs a loan for the service and general maintenance of her mototaxi. Delia's greatest wish is to save up to be able to provide a college degree for her children. She is very happy for the support provided by Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for general maintenance of her mototaxi

loans.name: Denis Horacio

texts.es:
Don Denis es trabajador y humilde junto a sus hijos y nietos vive en una comunidad al sur del país es conocido por sus vecinos por ser un hombre responsable.
Don Denis se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz esto lo hace desde su casa de habitación sus proveedores son los mismos agricultores de su zona.
Don Denis con el préstamo espera comprar maíz ya que se compra en esta época y luego él lo revenderá a otro precio mejor para obtener mejores ganancias. 
En un futuro el espera ser uno de los mejores proveedores de maíz en la zona esto con la ayuda de Dios y los crédito obtenidos.


Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre 2014
texts.en:
Denis is hardworking and humble.  Along with his children and grandchildren, he lives in a community in the south of the country. He is known by his neighbors for being a responsible man. Denis works buying and selling corn. He does this from his house. His suppliers are the farmers in the zone. Denis, with this loan, hopes to purchase corn since he purchases it in this season and later will resell it at a a better price to get more earnings.

In the future, he hopes to be one of the best suppliers of corn in the zone, this with the help of God and the loans he has gotten. 

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to purchase corn for his business.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
Fermín es un hombre de 61 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el comercio de ganado porcino.
Él es independiente, responsable y trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Batallas’ un área caracterizada porque se encuentra en la parte oeste del lago Titicaca y el Puerto Pérez, se encuentra a una altitud promedio de 3900 metros sobre el nivel del mar, tiene un pronunciado clima diurno en donde las variaciones de temperatura durante el día son más pronunciados a medida que avanza el año. La temperatura media anual en la región es de 8,8 centígrados.
Fermín es de tez morena, estatura alta, cabello negro, su lengua materna es el aymara que se habla en el lugar para el comercio en la ciudad habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de su madre la cual se dedica a la agricultura, viven en una casa de adobe que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es el comercio de ganado porcino; Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y desea realizar una inversión en el comercio de ganado porcino, realizando la compra de ganado mejorado. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en veinte años que viene realizando esta labor.
Es por esos motivos que Fermín solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado porcino  para ampliar su granja.
texts.en:
Fermín is a 61-year-old man, single, without children, and his business is selling pigs.

He is independent, responsible and hard-working. He does his work in the locality of Batallas, an area characterized by being located on the western part of Lake Titicaca and Puerto Pérez. It is at an average altitude of 3900 meters above sea level, it has a pronounced daytime climate in which the temperature variations during the day are more pronounced as the year progresses. The average annual temperature in the region is 8.8 degrees centigrade.

Fermín has olive skin, is short, has black hair, and his native language is Aymara which he speaks in that area, for his business in the city, he speaks Spanish. He lives in his mother's house, who works in agriculture. They live in an adobe house that has electricity and drinking water. His business is selling pigs. His dream is to improve his family's quality of life and he wants to make an investment in the sale of pigs, purchasing better pigs. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the twenty years that he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Fermín asks for a loan to purchase pigs to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to expand his farm.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Roeun, a widow lady, lives in the community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has two single children and one married child. To make a living and support the family, she has been involved in a farming business since 1985, growing rice and selling her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. 

The net profit that she can generate is USD 3.00 a day, on average.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.  

She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides

loans.name: Lelany

texts.en:
Lelany is operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic merchandise like noodles, canned goods, powdered milk, seasonings and soft drinks. She has been operating the store for almost six years now. She is a married woman with four kids. Her husband earns a living as a welder.

She has requested  a loan of 24,000 PHP to buy additional groceries for the store like canned goods, biscuits, noodles and soft drinks. These items are very essential to keep her store well stocked. It will help attract buyers to shop and purchase.
  
In the future, Lelany is trying her best to expand her current business to be able to provide her growing children with better living conditions and also to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries for the store like canned goods, biscuits, noodles and soft drinks

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is a merchant living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She engages in a rice retailing business. She sells rice to the locals in her community. She is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 15, and the youngest is 2.

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. With these, Jenilyn could cater her customers needs. She will have to sell a higher volume of rice, and eventually it will cause her to earn more and able to pay household expenses. 

Jenilyn will continue send her children to school for a brighter future and prepare healthy foods for the whole family.

Jenilyn is determined to expand her business to improve the family's status of living and to become sustainable, as well.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a responsible housewife who supported her husband in providing the necessities of her family. She is 44 years old and blessed with six children. Despite the hardship of living, they have the determination to uplift the status of their living. 

For almost seven years, Maria has engaged in buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the public market. To further improve this business, she needs additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Being a kind and industrious mother, Maria hopes that, someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en: Honorata is 49 years old, married and has four children. Her family lives at Tuguegarao. She cooks and sells snacks for income such as banana que (fried banana on a stick). She has been in her business for over 15 years now. She wants to keep selling delicious snacks and that is why she is asking for a loan to invest in her business. She is asking for P7,000 to buy bananas, cooking oil, and sugar. Additional revenue will be used for daily allowances for her children at school. (Her photo was taken in her stall with the supervisor beside her, visiting her business).

loans.use: to buy bananas, cooking oil, and sugar used in her food-selling business

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 40 years old and married with six children, four in school.  Ailene works very hard to provide for her family.

Ailene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, and sugar.

Ailene has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Ailene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, and sugar

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 34 years old, married and has three children, all in school.

Liza is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Liza has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Angélica

texts.es: Rosa es una joven de 20 años de edad, dedicada a su almacén de ropa y accesorios, hace cuatro años, comenzó junto con su cónyuge vendiendo blusas, jeans y bermudas a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, a quienes les ofrecía la mercancía para cancelar en cómodas cuotas, con tal éxito que decidieron en el año 2012 abrir una tienda de ropa. Tomaron en arriendo el local donde actualmente funciona el negocio, invirtieron en el surtido para el local, el cual  se ha diversificado, ahora ellos ofrecen jeans de difentes marcas y refencias, blusas, suéteres, calzado, gorras  y demás prendas de vestir, con ello él número de clientes se ha incrementado y su flujo de caja ha mejorado porque sus compras se realizan de contado.  Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo de 9 a.m. a 9 p.m., ella trabaja con mucho compromiso y dedicación, con la finalidad de cumplir con la meta de ampliar su negocio y aperturar un nuevo local. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual surtirá su negocio con los nuevos modelos de jeans, camisetas y suéteres, para aprovechar las fiestas en la que nos encontramos en los días de navidad. Rosa tiene como meta a futuro expandirse, ella quiero colocar dos almacenes.
texts.en: Rosa is a 20 year old young lady, dedicated to her clothing and accessory store. Four years ago, along with her common-law husband, she began selling blouses, jeans, and bermuda shorts to their neighbors, friends, and relatives offering the merchandise in exchange for comfortable installment payments. It was such a success that in 2012, they decided to open a clothing store. They rented the location where they currently operate their business, invested in inventory for the store, which is now diversified. They now offer different brands and styles of jeans, shirts, sweaters, footwear, hats, and other clothing items. This has increased their client base and improved their cash flow, since their purchases are now on a cash basis. Their daily schedule is from Monday to Sunday, from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. She works with great commitment and dedication, to achieve her goal of expanding her business and open a new location. She is now applying for the first time to a creditkiva loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, by which she will be able to supply her business with new models of jeans, t-shirts, and sweaters, to take advantage of the upcoming Christmas holidays. Rosa has set a goal in the future to expand her business, she wants to have two stores.

loans.use: To supply her business with new models of jeans, t-shirts, and sweaters

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 39 years old and married with seven children, five in school, Cheryl works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods.

Cheryl has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business and to send her children in school..

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, and canned goods

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nets.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nets.

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Flor, de 24 años de edad, está soltera y vive aun con su familia, la mayoría de sus hermanos se han ido de la casa para formar sus propios hogares. Sin embargo, unos cuantos hermanos se han quedado para ayudar en las tareas de la casa, ella además de trabajar, ha decidido montar su propia tienda

Flor, tiene varios días de estar trabajando en su tienda y ha visto mejoría en su negocio ya que ha incrementado el flujo de clientes, esto le ha llevado a comenzar a ahorrar para invertir en su educación el próximo año.

Flor, ocupa el crédito para surtir con más productos su tienda ya que ella calcula que las ventas mejorarán en los últimos días de Diciembre.

Flor, desea continuar sus estudios optando por un técnico o una carrera universitaria, ya que hace poco han abierto una universidad en su pueblo y le queda a menos de 10 minutos, todo dependerá de las ventas que genere en su tienda, una de sus hermanas está dispuesta a ayudarle, pero Flor quiere ser independiente.
texts.en:
Flor is 24 years old, she is single and still lives with her parents. Most of her siblings have left the house to start heir own homes. However some of them have stayed to help with the household tasks. As well as working, Flor has decided to start up her own shop.

She has worked in the shop for several days and she has noticed and improvement in the business as the flow of customers has increased and this has allowed her to start saving to invest in her education next year.

Flor will use the loan to stock up her shop with more products as she estimates that sales will improve in the last few days of December.

She wants to continue studying and may do a technical course or a university degree, because recently a university has been opened in her town less than 10 minutes away. All will depend on the sales from her shop. One of her sisters is happy to help her but Flor wants to be independent.

loans.use: to stock up her shop with more products as she estimates that sales will improve in the last few days of December.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza is 38 years old, and both of her children are in school.

Riza has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Riza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Riza would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Umida

texts.ru: Умида женщина 35 лет , замужем, молодая мать четверых детей . Она мечтала стать художницей,поступить в университет и получить высшее образование.Но в то время у ее родителей не было возможности оплатить её образование ,поэтому она вышла замуж и начала заниматься хозяйственными делами.Сейчас Умида работает на поле,выращивает фрукты и овощи и продаёт их на рынке.Её муж работает в России и отправляет деньги своей семье.Старший сын Умиды в этом году женится,но перед свадьбой Умида хотела бы отремонтировать дом .Но её не хватает денег для ремонта.Поэтму она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Она надеется,что МДО Арванд одобрит ее заявку на получение кредита и выделит ей нужную сумму.Умида выражает своё глубочайшее уважение и благодарность МДО Арванд.
texts.en: Umida is a 35-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She dreamed of becoming a painter, going to a university and obtaining a higher education, but at that time her parents did not have an ability to pay for her education, and this is why she got married and became involved in household work. Now Umida works on a field, growing fruits and vegetables that she then sells at a market. Her husband works in Russia and sends money to his family. Umida's oldest son is getting married this year, but Umida wants to repair her house prior to the wedding. She, however, does not have enough money for the repair. This is why she came to MDO Arvand for financial support. She hopes that MDO Arvand will approve her request for the loan and disburse the necessary sum. Umida expresses her deepest respect and gratitude to MDO Arvand.

loans.use: to buy building materials in order to repair her house

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Judith from Kapsowar Kenya, a woman from a community not known for farming, but one who is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married, and together with her husband she is blessed with four lovely children. For the past 10 years, Judith has been practicing mixed farming and, due to the experience she has, commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers who regard her as a mentor. Selling milk, eggs and vegetable has allowed her to earn a decent income. To make extra money, Judith also engages in a small personal business. 

Judith passionately loves dairy farming, and one of the animals on her farm has been given a nickname. Milking and feeding her cow makes her very proud. Through her milk sales, she has had quite good returns, and the demand for milk has been expanding. Through extensive use of her mobile phone, she has been receiving orders from customers. Because demand has been overwhelming, Judith is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow, a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce 10-20 litres of rich, creamy milk daily. The increased milk production will result in more income, and Judith will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children. 

When people listen to Judith speak, they can be forgiven for thinking that she is an expert in dairy farming because of her passion and determination. This loan will permanently change the living standards of Judith, and there is no doubt that rewarding employment can be found in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 63 years old and widowed, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elsie has been in this business for 16 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en: Mussarat is 44 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in the populated area of Lahore. She is a loving and caring mother. Her husband owns a small general store in the nearby community. He has many years of experience in this business. Being the sole earner in the family, he has to make sure that all the family expenses are met. Due to their big family size, it is difficult for him to cover all the expenses. Currently, he is running short of stock and he needs a loan to refurbish the inventory to increase sales. Her husband is hopeful that his investment will pay off and he will benefit from it.

loans.use: to help her husband refurbish the inventory at his general store

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 54-year-old married man with five children, living with his family in their own house in Sana'a city, Yemen. He has an elementary education. He lives with his family in an old house which needs a lot of renovation from the inside. 

Ali is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to make the necessary renovation for the house. He found himself incapable to renovate the house. There is only one way to solve this problem which is applying to Al- Amal Microfinance Bank and asking for a loan of 400,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement, bricks, and sand to make the necessary renovation for the house.

Ali hopes to rent out a part of his house after he finishes all the renovation of it.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks, and sand to make the necessary renovation for his house.

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en: Chin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Chin makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor, village coordinator and construction worker to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is 44 years old and single.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rachelle has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Rachelle aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Silvia Francisca

texts.es:
Silvia de 47 años casada, tiene tres hijos; dos de ellos estudian carrera superior y el último está aún en el colegio. Hace tres años viene desempeñando  su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda. Gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de su esposo ha logrado crecer en su negocio.
El mayor anhelo de Silvia es ver que sus hijos se realicen profesionalmente. Silvia solicitó el crédito para la compra de mercadería en ropa de segunda.
Silvia agradece a los inversionistas kiva por facilitarle este crédito
texts.en:
Silvia is 47 years old and is married with three children. Two of them are in college and the third is still in high school. For the past three years Silvia has worked selling secondhand clothing, and thanks to her efforts and to the support of her husband this business has thrived.

Silva's greatest hope is to see her children develop themselves professionally. She is asking for a loan to buy secondhand clothing to resell. Silvia thanks Kiva lenders for helping her to get this loan.

loans.use: buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Liz Katherine

texts.es:
Liz Katherine tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como patos, cuyes, conejos en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuenta con más de 08 años de experiencia en su negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de conejos y alimento balanceado para engorde de sus animales, con esto Liz Katherine espera ofrecer un prodcuto de mayor calidad a sus clientes lo que le reportará mayores niveles de ingreso y de esta manera aumentará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Liz Katherine is 35 years old, married, and lives with her husband and children in the Oyotun district.  This is a community where the residents work in agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade.  It is located in Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the northern highlands of Peru.

Liz Katherine has a business raising and selling small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, and rabbits, in the back of her house.  She has more than 8 years of experience with this business, and has good personal and work references from the neighborhood.  She has requested a loan to buy rabbits and animal feed to fatten her animals.  With this investment, Liz Katherine hopes to be able to offer a better quality product to her customers.  This will bring about more income for her, so that she can increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and animal feed

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida has a taxi transport business in Kitengela town and has been running this business for six years. She is 37 years old, married, and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children. 

She has requested her third loan from VisionFund Kenya and will use it to buy new tires and spare parts to service her taxi, so it can be in good condition. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her family's living standards and to pay school fees for her child. 

Wahida has successfully paid all her previous loans and, in the future, she hopes to be successful in her business and live well with her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Rey Group

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR ES MI REY ESTA CONFORMADO POR ONCE INTEGRANTES NUEVE MUJERES Y DOS HOMBRES,  MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE FAMILIA, CON HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE, LUGAR QUE SE CARACTERIZA POR SER PRODUCTORES  DE LECHE Y QUESO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR FORMA RESPONSABLE DE TRABAJAR, EN CRÉDITOS ANTERIORES HAN DEMOSTRADO RESPONSABILIDAD DE PAGO,  LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE DEDICARON A TRABAJAR DESDE TEMPRANA EDAD. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN CON SUS NEGOCIOS PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y MANTENER SU CLIENTELA, Y SU ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA.
GRACIAS A  SUS  GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA LA ELABORACIÓN Y VENTA DE TORTILLAS, EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN,  TIENE VEINTE AÑOS DE DEDICARSE  A DICHA ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA CON AYUDA DE UNA DE SUS HIJAS MAYOR, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS ELLA SE LEVANTA DESDE LAS CUATRO DE LA MAÑANA PARA NISQUEZAR, MOLER Y PREPARAR LAS TORTILLAS PARA LA VENTA MUY TEMPRANO. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES COMPRA MATERIA PRIMA COMO   :UN QUINTAL DE MAÍZ,  BOLSAS, CAL, LEÑA, COMAL ETC. EL SEÑOR ES MI REY AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
El Señor es Mi Rey is made up of eleven members, nine women and two men, mothers and fathers responsible for their families, with young children. They are from El Sauce, a place characterized as being a producer of milk and cheese. They are characterized by being responsible workers. With previous loans, they have showed responsibility with payments. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, they couldn't go to school and they started working when they were very young. Currently they struggle with their businesses to get ahead and maintain their customer bases and their economic stability. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator has as her job making and selling tortillas. The business is located in her house. She has been working in this trade for twenty years, with the help of her older daughters. This woman's work routine is some twelve hours daily offering her products. She gets up at four in the morning to sift, mill and prepare the tortillas for sale very early. The goal of this loan is to purchase raw materials such as a quintal of corn, bags, lime powder, firewood, a griddle, etc. El Señor es Mi Rey is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make tortillas such as a quintal [approximately 100 pounds] of corn, bags, lime powder, firewood, a griddle, etc.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Riza is 41 years old and has five children who are in school.

Riza has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Riza has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Kishimzhan
