With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf Alhaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yusuf Alhaji spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 32-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 10. 

Geraldine relies on her sari-sari (variety) store and on fishing, as well as the buying and selling of fresh fish to earn a living. Her husband helps in their business to support their children. This business started two years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets. This will better prepare her for new days of fishing. In the future, she would like to expand her business and make it bigger so she can give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, soft drinks, canned goods, and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Mariuxi Susana

texts.es:
Mariuxi tiene 26 años de edad tiene dos hijos es soltera y vive en Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos ya que es consultora Yambal, solicita el credito para la compra de estos productos para asi tener variedad en su mercaderia y poder vender para tener mas ganancia y poder solventar su hogar ya que es sola. Las compras realiza en Guayaquil cada mes, su sueño es agrandar su negocio y alcanzar las metas propuestas. en su tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mariuxi, 26, has 2 children and is single.  She lives in Echeandia in Bolivar province.  She is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Emprendedoras."  

Mariuxi has a business selling cosmetics; she is a Yambal brand consultant. She is requesting a loan to buy these products so that she can have a greater variety of merchandise.  This way she can sell more, increase her earnings, and cover her household expenses, because she is on her own.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil every month.  Mariuxi's dream is to expand her business and reach her goals.  In her free time, she enjoys spending time with her children.

loans.use: to invest in her business selling cosmetics

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a 62-year-old widow supporting three children.

Veronicah is a farmer and has been in business for the last 24 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Veronicah has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 5,000  to purchase farm inputs like fertilizer, seedlings as well as to set aside wages for her laborers.

With the anticipated profits, Veronicah will be able to educate her children.

Her hope and dream for the future is to grow her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio, tiene la edad  de 81años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de unos terneros para el engorde y que tengan buenas características en el rápido desarrollo y ganancia de peso. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Antonio, 81 years old, is married and lives with his wife, who is his first priority. With his loan, he means to buy some calves to fatten that have the good characteristics of rapid development and weight gain. The idea is to take advantage of the grazing space he has and the good land and climate conditions in order to be able to have these animals and raise calves in order to sell them for meat in the future. With this purchase, he will be able to develop another activity, and at the same time have some savings that will allow him to go on having more animals and to invest more in the property. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy beef calves

loans.name: Noonkida

texts.en:
Noonkida is 37 years old, widowed and a mother of five children. She sells goats in the town of Narok and has been in this business for 10 years. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She plans to use this loan to buy goats to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to buy goats and sheep to sell later. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. Her future hopes are to expand her farming business, to be successful and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline has a retail shop in Machakos town and has been running this business for five years. She is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. 

She will use this loan to expand her business by buying more goods such as flour, cooking fat, rice, sugar and cereals to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 35 years. She is a single mother blessed with one child.

Lilian sells gas cylinders, a business she has done for the last 6 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 28,000.

Lilian has requested for her 3rd loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 70,000, which she will use to stock her shop with more gas cylinders.

With the anticipated profits, Lilian will be able to repay her loan as well as expand her business further.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to educate her son to University level.

loans.use: to stock her shop with more gas cylinders.

loans.name: Oloishuro

texts.en:
Oloishura sells goats in Narok town and has been in this business for 5 years. He is 28 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more goats to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to buy cattle. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and his future hopes are to expand his farming business, make more income and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.

Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Valencia.

Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito con la Corporación Interactuar para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes, abonos y la compra de semillas de café.

El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.
Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a campesino.  He's a modest, hard-working man who possesses the drive and grit so common to the men and women of rural Colombia.  He learned farming and animal-rearing when he was just a boy and has combined his knowledge of farming and his entrepreneurial bent to build a coffee-growing business.  He sells what he harvests in the market at Valencia.

Carlos is applying to Corporación Interactuar for a loan that he will use to buy supplies--fertilizer, coffee seeds, etc.--for carrying on his business. The investment will support his efforts to grow the business and move ahead as both a person and an entrepreneur.  What he most wants, he says, is to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Alhaji Magaji

texts.en: Alhaji Magaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Alhaji Magaji joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Musa, Shamsu, and Libabatu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Alhaji Magaji spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Rabiu and Habi. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Iliya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Iliya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 29 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling rice, raising pigs, and growing fruits and vegetables. Daisy is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, and candies for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, biscuits, and candies

loans.name: Myrden Joy

texts.en:
Myrden Joy is 44 years old, married, and has 2 children who are both in school.

Myrden Joy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrden Joy has previously borrowed and successfully repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for 20 years and also earns income from selling personal care products.

Myrden Joy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is single and has a business in the Philippines selling tobacco. She has been running her business for 16 years now.

Evangeline has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase more supplies of tobacco to resell.

Evangeline has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting this second loan to further build her business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Susemarry

texts.en:
Susemarry is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Susemarry works very hard to provide for them.

Susemarry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell. Susemarry has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Susemarry would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Alice, a very hard-working, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past five years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes, she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. 
Alice lives near Kapsaiya in the Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. 
The Kapsaiya area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Alice intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully, breakdowns will be few and far between. 
To accomplish this, Alice is applying for a 50,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Alice sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kind support.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill for processing maize flour.

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
A mother of six children living in Kampong Speu province, Nai is 51 years old. For her family’s living, she grows rice as the single source of her income. She can earn income of about 25,000 KHR per day.

This is the first cycle for Nai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for a latrine. She hopes that she can update her family’s living for good health.

loans.use: to pay for a latrine.

loans.name: Mara's Group

texts.en: Mara is 47 years old and a mother of one child. She lives in Kampong Speu province. Mara earns income to support her family through rice cropping. She can earn income of about 28,300 KHR per day. This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of nine members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy a latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living conditions by promoting good health.

loans.use: To buy a latrine.

loans.name: Chifuniro Group

texts.en:
Elube thanks Kiva for granting her the previous loan. She used the loan to purchase more fish, and this helped to increase her supply of fish to the market, thereby also increasing her profits. From the profits she made, Elube used the money to send her son to a better school and she was also able to buy household equipment.

She is requesting another loan in order to expand her business activities by also opening a grocery in her area, as she wants to increase her sources of income and not rely on fish selling alone.

She plans to use the profits from this business to improve her family's living standard and alleviate her household's level of poverty.

loans.use: to buy assorted items

loans.name: Om Khalaf Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om Khalaf. It consists of six women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 390,000 YER from AMB.

Bahja is the leader of the group: a married woman with 6 children, living with her family in a small house which needs expanding. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife and her husband works in a grocery with a monthly salary which is not enough to cover the family expenses. 

The house where the family lives needs expanding and Bahja doesn't have sufficient money. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction supplies and carpentering materials to build other rooms inside the house to make it large enough for all members of the family.

Bahja looks forward to providing her family with a better future.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies and materials to build more rooms in the house

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana used the previous amount generated by Kiva to remodel her kitchen and install a stable heating system. Her business remains self-sustainable, offering a nice selection of merchandise.

This time Oksana is hoping to use 30,000 Grivnyas to make a fireplace in her house which will help save on gas bills, keeping the house warm during the cold winter season.

loans.use: to make a fireplace in her house which will help save on gas bills, keeping the house warm during the cold winter season.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man who does agriculture, both animal rearing and crop farming, in a rural area in western Uganda.

He was motivated to acquire loan after realizing that the people that had borrowed from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited were progressing. 

Ali will use the loan to buy cows that he will fatten and then sell at a profit. He is hard-working and resilient. He will do all it takes to repay the loan to maintain a good relationship with the lenders.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander works in a bakery. He also owns a small grocery store in his home town of Vinogradovo. He rents a facility that he uses for the store. His mother works there as a salesperson. At the moment Alexander lives together with his parents in a small private house. 

Alexander wants to make an addition to his house--build on two more rooms to the living facility where he and his parents reside at the moment. He is single right now, however, a wedding is in his short-term plans. Therefore, Alexander is hoping that this expansion will add comfort to the living conditions of both families that will be sharing this house in the future.

loans.use: to make an addition to his house--build on two more rooms to the living facility where he and his parents reside at the moment

loans.name: Delmy Lorena

texts.es: Delmy de 30 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 7 años de edad. Ella siempre está buscando la manera de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, por lo que se gana la vida con su trabajo de empacadora de alimentos en una empresa cercana, además los fines de semana vende verduras para tener mejores ingresos que le permitan mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia. Delmy desea construir las paredes de su vivienda de cemento y ladrillo, ya que actualmente son de bajareque y ella desea que sean un poco más seguras e higiénicas, porque en las que tiene se hacen anidaciones de plagas que pueden afectar la salud de su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir las paredes de cemento y ladrillo de su vivienda. Expresa estar muy agradecida por el apoyo recibido en el pasado.
texts.en:
Delmy, 30, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her 3 children, aged 12, 10 and 7.  She is always seeking a way to give the best to her children.  This is why she earns a living working as a food packer in a nearby company.  In addition, on the weekends she sells vegetables to increase her income and keep her family's finances stable. 

Delmy wants to replace the walls of her house, which are currently made of wattle and daub, with bricks and cement, because she wants to make her home more secure and hygienic.  Currently, there are pests that nest in the walls which can affect the health of her family.  This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and steel to build walls made of bricks and cement in her home.  She states that she is very grateful for the support that she has received in the past.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.en:
Muzafar is a strong woman. She was born in 1963. She lives in a village. She is married. She has one child. Her husband is an emigrant. 

She likes to sew. She has had a business of sewing dresses since 1991. Basically, she sews national dresses. The income of her business is spent for raising her son. It is hard for Muzafar to be alone in providing for her family. 

She dreams of educating her son. She needs financial support for the education of her child.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her child.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Josefina  sigue dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia continua elaborando desayunos, almuerzos y cenas para sus clientes que le solicitan cada dia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, menestras, carnes, arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
Josefina continues to manage her restaurant business. She appreciates the assistance that has been offered and promises to complete her loan payments in a disciplined manner. Josefina continues to prepare breakfasts, lunches, and dinners for her customers who request them each day. In this manner, she is able to help her family move forward.

Josefina is requesting a loan in order to buy oil, stews, meats, rice, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy oil, stews, meats, rice, and other supplies.

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.en:
Mashkhura is a businesslady. She was born in 1995. She is from the northern part of Tajikistan. She lives in a rural area. She is married. She lives with her mother-in-law.

Mashkhura has started a new business. She and her husband work in the agriculture field. Her husband works planting a crop. She wants to work with livestock. She has experience keeping livestock from her childhood. She is in need of support for starting her business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy livestock for organizing a new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy livestock for organizing a new business

loans.name: Sanare

texts.en:
Sanare is 43 years old and married. He and his spouse have been blessed with 10 children. Sanare is engaged in farming in Narok town where he grows cash crops and rears livestock. He has been in this business for 20 years, and it has been profitable.

Sanare plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and livestock for rearing. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his sixth loan from VisionFund Kenya and he repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to grow his business, be prosperous, and live well with his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seedlings, and sheep for rearing.

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Iloilo, Philippines. Jeanilyn makes money through her hog raising business.  She has been raising pigs for more than 10 years now.

Jeanilyn believes that a hog raising business is a good investment. With that, she wants to expand her business and decided to request a loan from CEVI to buy more piglets to raise as well as animal feed. 

This loan will give her the opportunity to improve her business and augment her profit from it. In the future, Jeanilyn would like to improve their livelihood and save enough money to pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Yermy

texts.es: Yermy, tiene la edad  de 25 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hija y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca para leche y  con una cría al destete y también se encuentra preñada. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de leche y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yermy is 25 years old. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and daughter, who are his main priority. He wants to use this loan to buy another cow for milk. The idea is to put his pastures to good use and make the most of the good land and weather conditions in order to keep his animals, while at the same time producing milk and raising calves to sell for meat in the future. This purchase will allow him to diversify his business and save more money to purchase more animals and invest in his property in the future. 

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He had never accessed a loan through a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offers loans with easier payment terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a mum ready and raring to go to face the world and have a full life thanks to her efforts. She is a 39-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kerugoya, which is a small rural town in the central province of Kenya. Grace and her husband have been blessed with two children. For 10 years Grace has been a mixed-farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, she finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides dairy farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive, hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. Grace, however, is taking this a little step further. Grace is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens are always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 52 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail charcoal business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables and meat.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Abdu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Markus, Joel and Sunday.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Abdu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cover his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Abdu spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, de 59 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en una comunidad muy reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional por su organización comunitaria y por las organizaciones que desde ahí luchan por los derechos humanos y recursos naturales.

María, ha vivido ganándose el pan de cada día, gracias a sus esfuerzos como costurera, pero también, se dedica a la venta de gas propano y por las tardes vende bocadillos en su comunidad.

María, pretende invertir el dinero para comprar telas, hilos, agujas y demás enceres necesarios para costurar. Ella ha logrado conseguir un modesto contrato con el ministerio de educación del gobierno central de El Salvador, para la elaboración de uniformes para los alumnos del sistema público de educación y para ello necesita tener cierto capital, ya que el ministerio paga los uniformes hasta que ya están hechos.

María, quiere trabajar junto a su familia para poder comprar el terreno donde actualmente vive, ya que los dueños le han dicho que se lo venden en un precio muy bajo, debido a que ella tiene mucho tiempo viviendo en esta zona.
texts.en:
Maria, 59, lives with her children in a community that is well-known at the national and international level for its community organizing and the organizations there that fight for human rights and natural resources.

Maria has earned a living thanks to her efforts as a dressmaker.  She also has a business selling propane gas, and in the afternoons she sells snacks in her community.

Maria plans to invest this money in fabric, thread, needles, and other supplies she needs for dressmaking.  She has managed to obtain a modest contract with the Ministry of Education of the Central Government of El Salvador to make uniforms for the students in the public school system.  To do this, she needs to have some capital, because the Ministry does not pay for the uniforms until they are already made.

Maria wants to work along with her family to buy some land where she currently lives, because the owners have told her that they will sell at a very low price, since she has spent so much time living in this neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María es casada tiene 33 años de edad tiene dos hijos de 10 años y uno de tres meses, vive en Echeandia provincia de Bolivar. Pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras.

Solicita el credito para la compra de mercaderia para la tienda para agrandarla y tener mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, realiza las compras en Guaranda cada semana, su sueño comparse una casa y en su tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 3 months). She lives in Echeandia in Bolivar Province. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women).

She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her store so that she can expand and have more products to offer to her customers. María makes her purchases in Guranda each week. Her dream is to buy a house and she enjoys listening to music in her free time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store so that she can expand and have more products to offer.

loans.name: Silvia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Silvia es una joven de 22 años, sin hijos, actualmente vive con un hermano en una casa arrendada en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los  Colorados, ciudad caracterizada por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones del país. 
Silvia es una chica muy alegre y carismática, ahora está cursando el sexto semestre en la universidad en la carrera de Hotelería y Turismo, estudia a partir de las seis de la tarde hasta horas de la noche; ella aun así está muy feliz porque le encanta esta carrera, por ello hace más de un año se puso un pequeño local de Decoraciones, donde da el servicio de comida, atención para fiestas, animaciones y alquiler de mantelería y sillas. Con estos ingresos ella se ayuda para salir adelante.
Ahora solicitó un crédito, comenta nunca haber trabajado con instituciones financieras; el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más mantelería ya que debe alquilar porque no cuenta con los suficientes para su negocio, y esta época es muy buena ya que tiene que organizar y decorar varios eventos.
Silvia está muy feliz, ya que podrá darse a conocer en el sistema financiero y podrá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 22-year-old young woman. She has no children and currently lives with a brother in a rented house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city distinguished for being the point of land that unites the country's regions.

Silvia is a very happy and charismatic girl. Right now she is in her sixth semester at the university in the Hotel and Tourism degree program. She studies from six in the evening until the night hours; even so, she is very happy because she loves this program. For that reason, more than a year ago she started a small decorations shop, where she provides catering service, service for parties, animations, and table linen and chair rental. With this income, she is helping herself move ahead.

Now she has asked for a loan; she notes that she has never worked with financial institutions. She will use the loan to buy more table linens, since she has to rent because she doesn't have enough for her business, and this time of year is very good because she has to organize and decorate several events.

Silvia is very happy, since she will be able to make herself known in the financial system and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy table linens and decorations for her events; in the future she will finish her studies and work full time on her business

loans.name: Alh. Nasuru

texts.en: Alh. Nasuru is a maize farmer from Danju Gubuchi village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Alh. Nasuru had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Nasuru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. Alh. Nasuru, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family, and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Murtala, Amadu, and Sa'Idu. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40 percent higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Dahiru spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. Yahuza joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Yosiya, Efremu, and Magret.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yahuza can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Yahuza spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to pay for children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en:
Sanavbar is a business woman. She was born in 1959. She lives in rural area, is married, and has three children. She works at cooperative with the clients. She is a responsible, active, and hardworking person. 

Sanavbar is planning to prepare her house for winter. She needs to buy a heater and is asking for financial support.

loans.use: to buy a heater for her household.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay next year's tuition and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en: Bertha is married and has a three-year-old son. She works as a cook for a little company that organizes social events such as parties, dinners, lunches, marriages, etc. Bertha and her husband have a business of their own. They have a car and they use it as a taxi that is driven by Bertha and her husband (both of them take turns). Recently her husband had an accident and the car needs to be repaired. Fortunately her husband is fine but the car needs repairs in the front part and the engine. Bertha is in good shape and she hopes you can help her because she and her husband will do anything to repay the loan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs in the front part and the engine.

loans.name: Inmer Samuel

texts.es:
Inmer, de 37 años de edad, estudió, sexto grado de educación,  está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tienen 3 hijos los cuales viven con ellos, dos de ellos estudian. 

Inmer, se dedica a la albañilería y tiene 16 años de dedicarse a eso.- El trabajo de la albañilería la aprendió de su padre quien desde pequeño le enseñó la actividad.


Inmer, trabaja en todo el  municipio donde vive,  actualmente no tiene otra actividad económica y su horario de trabajo es de 8 horas al día.


Inmer, con el dinero del crédito comprará palas, piochas, carretillas, cintas milimétricas, entre otras herramientas que necesita para desarrollar su trabajo. 

El préstamo le ayudará a mejorar su trabajo porque ya no tendrá que andar prestando, para desarrollar su trabajo. La necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener sus propias herramientas. 

Los sueños de Inmer son: seguir trabajando fuerte, tener las herramientas que necesita y para su familia desea que sus hijos estudien y tengan una vida digna.
texts.en:
Inmer, 37 years old, studied through sixth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household tasks. They have 3 children, who live with them. Two of them are in school.

Inmer works as a bricklayer and has for 16 years. He learned bricklaying from his father, who taught him from the time he was little.

Inmer works all over the city in which he lives. Currently he does not have any other work and his schedule is 8 hours per day.

With the loan, Inmer will buy shovels, pickaxes, wheelbarrows, and measuring tape, among other items that he needs to do his work.

The loan will help him to improve his work because he will not have to go around borrowing in order to do his work. The need satisfied will be that of having his own tools.

Inmer's dreams are to continue working hard and to have the tools he needs, and for his family he wants his children to study and have a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy shovels, pickaxes, wheelbarrows, and measuring tape, among other tools he needs to do his work

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrelia is 49, married, and has only one child. She owns and manages a small bakeshop, while her husband works as a jeepney driver. They help each other in gaining income to sustain the necessities of their family.

Estrelia aspires to improve her small bakeshop by preparing more bread recipes to sell, but she has not enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access a PHP 9,000 loan to be used in buying flour, sugar, lard, margarine, yeast, milk, and other ingredients she needed to cook and sell.

She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve more of her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, lard, margarine, yeast, and milk needed for her bakeshop business.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 35-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 6 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for providing for the needs of the family. Salma provides sewing services to earn additional income to contribute to managing the household.
 
Salma needs different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, cloth, and machine oil for her business. Due to insufficient funds, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan through its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories. She hopes this will help her to increase monthly sales and profits by providing better sewing services.

Salma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for her tailoring business

loans.name: Sule

texts.en:
Sule is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona Farmers Organization member, Sule would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sule can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Like other Babban Gona members, Sule is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family and he hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tanveer's Group

texts.en:
Tanveer, 38 years old and a mother of 4 children, is a dedicated housewife living in the populated area of Lahore. She is loving and caring. Her husband has an iron business where he buys scrap iron and molds it into products like gates, handles, panels, etc. He is skilled and hardworking. I

n order to complete orders that he is now getting more frequently, he needs scrap iron. For this purpose, Tanveer has requested a loan to help her husband buy scrap iron. She is pleased to have helped her husband and is hopeful that this investment will be fruitful.

loans.use: to help her husband buy scrap iron for his iron business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa earns a living by engaging in a cigarette vending business. She buys and sells cigarettes in retail and in bulk. She is a 42-year-old married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. Four of them are still attending school. It has been four years now that she has been engaged in this kind of business. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter. To have an additional source of income, she also engages in farming. 

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of tobacco, to purchase fertilizers, and for additional capital for a hog-raising startup. These materials are very helpful in augmenting her livelihood. She will be harvesting more yield and selling healthy pigs in the few months to come. Josefa will be providing proper food and better living conditions.

She dreams to manage both her businesses to be successful and to be able to continue to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tobacco, purchase fertilizers, and access additional capital for hog-raising startup

loans.name: Saliyakan

texts.ru: Салиякан, 55 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, уже много лет в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Салиякан на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 20 овец. На участке мерою 4,0 Га она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Салиякан обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 9 овец. Доходы от кредита Салиякан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также накопить средства на постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Saliyakan is 55 years old and married. She has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry for many years in order to provide the primary income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, today Saliyakan's farm contains 2 cows, 1 horse and 20 sheep. She grows clover for the farm use on 4.0 hectares of land. In order to grow her business, Saliyakan requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 9 sheep. Saliyakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock headcount and also wants to save money to build a barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to buy 9 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Kiptoo

texts.en:
Kiptoo is a 30-year-old single man who has been a farmer for a period of six years. He earns an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Kiptoo was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farm plantation.

Kiptoo plans to use the anticipated income to start a livestock farming business and hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Terina

texts.en:
Terina is 43 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Terina has borrowed and paid sixteen loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Zohir

texts.en: Zohir is a hardworking man. He was born in 1934. He is from the northern part of Tajikistan. He is married. He has four children. His wife works in an airport. He has been as working in the government for almost forty years. His specialty is a lawyer. He works in city court. Every day he solves decisions of the court according to the legislation of the country. He is a responsible and honest person. He wants to educate his daughter. Zohir dreams that someday he will be proud of his daughter. He needs financial support for paying the education tuition of his daughter.

loans.use: to pay the education tuition of his daughter.

loans.name: Seeman

texts.en: Seeman is a 42-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Seeman’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Seeman has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en:
Bala is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bala joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Hassan, Kabiru, and Musbahu.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bala would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bala can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Bala spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy has a retail shop in Narok town and has been running this business for 4 years. She is 22 years old and married and, together with her spouse, they have been blessed with 1 child.

She has requested her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya and will use it to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include items such as sugar, tea leaves, flour, rice, and cooking oil.

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. In future she hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods to sell, including sugar, tea leaves, flour, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea engages in the raising and selling of chickens. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs. She is 50 year old with four grown children. She lives in Ormoc, Leyte.

She is asking a loan in the amount of 24,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed. In the coming months, she will be able to produce and sell healthy pigs. She will be earning more and eventually she will start to pay for the loan and other household expenses.

Aurea hopes to expand her business to make it successful for sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Kalyskan

texts.ru: Калыскан 55 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 4 детей. У Калыскан средне-специальное образование, она работает сторожем, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав в 2003 году. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Калыскан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы, 1 лошадь и 30 овец. На 3,0 Га земли она выращивает клевер для внутрихозяйственного потребления. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Калыскан составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для закупки скота. Калыскан намерена развивать свой бизнес, увеличивая тем самым ее доходы, что позволит накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kalyskan is 55 years old, married and, together with her husband, raised 4 children. Kalyskan has a specialized secondary education and works as a security guard. To provide additional income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2003. Thanks to Kalyskan's persistence, drive and hard work, today she has 2 cows, 1 horse and 30 sheep. She grows clover for the farm use on 3.0 hectares of land. Kalyskan's combined monthly income amounts to about 15,000 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy livestock. Kalyskan intends to develop her business, thus, increasing her income, which will allow her to save money for housing repairs.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to grow her business

loans.name: Judith Silvania

texts.es:
Judith tiene 41 años de edad vive en San Mguel Provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado Chico, pertenece a a ventanilla rural San Francisco.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, frejol y papas, solicita el credito para la compra de insumos fertilizantes semillas para sembrar y mejorar la producción, gracias a este credito podra comprar lo necesario y tener una siembra mucho mejor que las anteriores y solventar a sus tres hijos ya que es viuda y no cuenta con nadie mas. Las compras realiza cada semana en San Miguel en la feria. En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo con sus hijos y salir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Judith is 41 years old and lives in San Miguel in the province of Bolivar. It’s part of the Salado Chico community which belongs to the rural San Francisco community bank.

Judith is a farmer and grows maize, beans, and potatoes. She is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant and thus increase production. Thanks to this loan she will be able to buy these necessities and have a much better harvest than she did previously. She will be able to pay for the items her children need since she is a widow and has no one else to help her. 

Judith will make her purchases in the San Miguel market. In her spare time she enjoys being with her children and going to church.

loans.use: buy farming supplies

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es:
Maria tiene 52 años de edad es casada y tiene 7 hijos con los que vive en San Miguel provincia de Bolivar en la comunidad Salado chico, pertenece a la ventanilla rural San Francisco.

Ella es una persona humilde que no tiene un trabajo seguro por lo que se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz y papas, solicita el credito para el pago del arriendo del terreno en donde va a sembrar y para comprar fertilizantes agricolas para la siembra para asi mejorar la produccion por el bienestar de su familia. Las compras realiza en San Miguel cada 8 dias, en su tiempo libre le gusta realizar trabajos didacticos y salir a pasear con sus hijos.
texts.en: Maria is 52 years old.married and has 7 children. She lives in San Miguel, Bolivar province in the community of Salado Chico, part of the rural district of San Francisco. She is a simple person who has no fixed employment so she works in agriculture growing corn and potatoes. She is requesting a loan to pay for the lease on the land where she is going to grow and to buy fertilizers for her crops to increase production for the well-being of her family. She makes her purchases every 8 days in San Miguel and in her free time she likes to do educational work and go out with her children.

loans.use: to pay to lease the land and buy fertilizers to grow corn.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Benkan ont en moyenne 31 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Minkoungo l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Minkoungo. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits, des draps, du savon, des chaussures plastiques et des encens. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata(femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une vendeuse de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1sac  de chaussures (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures en gros au grand marché.La revente se fait en détails à Minkoungo et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in polygamous households, the five members of the Benkan group are on average 31 years old with two children. They all live in Minkoungo, one of Bamako's districts. They became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities in Minkoungo.

Group members are small retail merchants of clothing, sheets, soap, plastic shoes and incense. To increase their working capital, group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle.

Mrs. Fatoumata (the woman sitting at the far left in the photo) sells all kinds of plastic shoes (for men and women). She plans to use her loan to buy wholesale at the main market one bag of shoes (for men and women) in different sizes. Retail sales are conducted in Minkoungo as an itinerant vendor to a clientele made up mostly of women.

With this loan Mrs. Fatoumata hopes to achieve average monthly profits of 50,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the business and used to meet the household's small needs.

loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi has a farming supply store 'Seignoir Tomato' in Kamenka, where he lives. He sells tomato and cucumber seeds, farming chemicals, and plastic and metal gardening tools. Yuryi has been working in this sphere of business for over 20 years. 

Recently, Yuryi opened a small new vending location in the neighboring village of Vodyanoye. His wife is now working at that little store. Yuryi had to split his merchandise between the two locations, which is why he is now seeking to restock it and expand his trade even further.

Yuryi is planning to invest an additional 20 000 Grivnyas to purchase a batch of seeds wholesale for further retail sale at his store. Despite the uncertainty in the country and war in the east that results in price leaps and poor sales, Yuryi continues to persevere and press on, pursuing his business goals.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of seeds wholesale for further retail sale at his store.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is a farmer from Malaya Kardashinka. He has been running his greenhouse business for 15 years. He owns a land lot of 30 acres where he grows early and late vegetables – tomatoes, cucumbers, and Chinese cabbage.
 
Sergei is seeking a loan of 20 000 Grivnyas to construct a new greenhouse to replace the old one that has been falling apart. He is planning to use the generated profits to further re-invest in his farming business, as well as meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to construct a new greenhouse to replace the old one that has been falling apart.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge y su hija en el distrito de La Matanza, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería, comercio de plátano, etc.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado vacuno (vacas) y aves de corral como gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros. Adicionalmente brinda servicios como obrero agrícola en la zona. Cuenta con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para la crianza y posterior comercialización, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado. Con esto Domingo espera mejorar la producción de su negocio, incrementando así su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
48-year old Domingo lives with his wife and daughter in the district of La Matanza, Morropón province, Piura region, on Peru’s north coast. Life there is calm. The local people are involved in agriculture, livestock raising, banana growing etc.

Domingo earns his living raising and selling cows and poultry such as chickens, ducks, turkeys etc. As well he takes on farm laboring jobs in the area. He has been farming for more than five years and has very good personal and work references. 

Domingo plans to use the loan to buy more cows to raise and then sell, and specialized feed for them. In this way he hopes to improve his business and increase income, resulting in a better quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: buy more cows to raise and sell, and specialized animal feed

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson Enrique tiene 36 años de edad, es casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropón su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus clientes a las zonas aledañas a su distrito, también se dedica a la venta de combustible. Cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de piezas mecánicas para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento a su mototaxi, con esto Nelson Enrique espera mejorar el servicio que brinda a sus clientes, incrementando así su nivel de ingresos y mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson Enrique is 36 years old and married.  He  lives with his wife and children in the Morropon district. The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce, and livestock farming. It is in Piura region along the northern coast of Peru.

He provides a public transportation service with his ‘mototaxi’ [three-wheeled motorized vehicle], driving customers from neighboring villages to his district. He also sells fuel.  He has experience in the field, and he has very good personal and work references in the area.

He has requested a loan to buy mechanical parts in order to provide adequate maintenance to his mototaxi.  With this, Nelson Enrique hopes to improve the service that he provides to his customers.  This way he will be increasing his earnings and improving his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy mechanical parts in order to provide adequate maintenance to his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, baby clothes, sandals, trousers, and T-shirts to sell for Christmas and to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un señor de 32 años, actualmente vive en casa de su jefe, ya que además de su negocio trabaja como jornalero por las tardes; Vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy productivo y comercial.
Juan es un señor trabajador, desde muy temprano él se levanta a comprar leche en fincas aledañas al sector y en su moto sale a recorrer a la ciudad a ofrecer su producto principal que es la leche, lleva ya listo en fundas de un litro, las mismas que guarda en una mochila; ya en las tardes regresa para atender la finca donde trabaja muchos años.
Juan con el crédito obtenido podrá comprar un coche y dos tanques de leche para poder transportar mejor el producto ya que es muy incómodo como lo hace ahora.
Comenta que gracias a estos pequeños créditos los microempresarios pueden superarse, agradece a la institución y a todas las personas que aportan a Kiva para hacer posible los sueños de muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is a 32-year-old gentleman who currently lives at his employer's house, since aside from having his own business he also works as a laborer in the afternoons. He lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a very productive and commercial area.

Juan is a hard worker. He gets up early in the mornings to go buy milk from neighboring ranches and travels on his motorbike all over town offering his main product, which is milk. He carries it already prepared in one-liter containers which he keeps in a backpack. In the afternoons he comes back and tends to the farm where he has been working for many years.

With this loan, Juan will be able to buy a car and two milk tanks in order to transport his product more easily, since his current method is very uncomfortable. He says that these small loans allow micro entrepreneurs to improve themselves, so he wants to thank this organization and everyone who supports Kiva for helping borrowers like himself make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy a car and two milk tanks to transport his product and increase his business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of four children ages five to sixteen. She hails from Carles, Iloilo. Maribel has been engaged in the fishing business for many years. Her husband has worked as a fisherman since their marriage. Maribel is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights and floaters. Through these available tools, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market for a profit. Maribel dreams of improving their livelihood and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights and floaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil, and condiments

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 33 years old and she is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to icrease her sales.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer from Duna village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Haruna would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Haruna can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest.

Haruna, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family. He hopes to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en:
Shafiu is a maize farmer from Mafera village in Kaduna state. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Shafiu would have to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest to cater to his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shafiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Shafiu, like other members of Babban Gona, intends to use the extra income to provide food and clothing for his family. He hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing for his family, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 24-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband, two children, who go to the local kindergarten, and pensioner grandmother. Marina married at an early age and wasn’t able to work despite having a university degree. She looks after her children and stays home, but she has a great desire to be involved in her own business.

The family is involved in the agricultural business, growing walnut trees and selling the harvested walnuts. As the existing income is not enough for a five-member family, Marina decided to get a loan for starting up her business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,600 Gel to open a food market. With the received credit, Marina will rent a space and will purchase a stock of food products, such as flour, sugar, and so on to resell among her neighbors.

She is a very motivated young woman with a great desire to increase the family’s income in order to improve the living conditions of her children.

loans.use: to start up a food market and increase the family's income.

loans.name: Memia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Memia works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Memia is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle passenger business.

Memia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Living in Kampong Cham province, Saran is 39 years old and the mother of two children. To make her living, she grows rice on one hectare as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.

This is the first time for Saran with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. She hopes that she can improve her farmland and have a bigger harvest than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ngun's Group

texts.en:
Ngun is 44 years old and has three children who attend school. She lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She earns an income from fishing and working for others for a fee. 

Ngun requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy fishing instruments. She hopes that she can catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing instruments.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana de 30 años de edad pone todo su esfuerzo en su trabajo para sostener la economía de su hogar, ella elabora prendas de vestir en una empresa cercana, pero siempre buscando tener mejores ingresos vende ropa para dama y caballero los fines de semana de forma ambulante y así obtener mejores ingresos que le brinden mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 7, 12 y 15 años de edad. Ana desea contar con una mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para dama y caballero, además desea vender productos de belleza, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en ropa para dama y caballero y productos de belleza para vender en esta temporada de fin de año que es cuando las ventas son mejores.
texts.en:
Ana is thirty years old. She puts all her effort into her work so that she can support her family. She manufactures clothing for a loacal company, but she's always looking for ways to improve her income, so she also sells men and women's clothing as a street vendor on the weekends. This allows her to obtain extra income so that she can provide her family with better living conditions. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, who are ages seven, twelve, and fifteen. 

Ana wants to have more men and women's clothing items, and she also wants to sell beauty supplies, which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will use it to invest in men and women's clothing and beauty supplies to sell this holiday season, which is when sales are at their peak.

loans.use: to invest in men and women's clothing and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Lisdy Cristina

texts.es:
LISDY DE 23 AÑOS DE EDAD ES MADRE SOLTERA CON UN HIJO MENOR DE EDAD, ES ORIGINARIA DEL SAUCE, SE HA CARACTERIZADO POR SER RESPONSABLE, TRABAJADORAS, EN SUS CRÉDITOS ANTERIORES, HA DEMOSTRADO SER BUENA PAGA, CUMPLE CON SUS PAGOS EN TIEMPO Y FORMA,  LAMENTABLEMENTE NO PUDO ESTUDIAR PERO  POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONÓMICOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHA PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO HACERLO CRECER, MANTENER SU CLIENTELA Y OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS,  Y A LA VES PROPORCIONALES A SUS HIJO ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE SU ACTIVIDAD ES UNA PULPERIA, ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRÉJOLES, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, QUESO, DETERGENTE, JABÓN, FRUTAS, FÓSFOROS, ACEITE ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIOS UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, Y BRINDARLE UN BUEN SERVICIO AL CLIENTE. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES  PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. LISDY AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
Lisdy, age 23, is a single mother with a young child. She is from El Sauce. She is known for being responsible and hard-working. She has proven to repay her loans on time and properly. Unfortunately, she was unable to study due to lack of economic resources, She is currently fighting to get her business ahead and make it grow. She wants to maintain her clientele and obtain a greater income while providing her children with economic stability.
Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she has a corner store. It is a small store where she sells edible products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, detergent, soap, fruit, matches, oil, etc. She spends twelve hours per day on her business and provides good service to all her clients. 
The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of edible products so that in the near future she will be able to obtain a better income. Lisdy is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide for people with scarce resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a dignified means of making a living.

loans.use: to invest in products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, cheese, detergent, soap, fruit, matches, oil, etc.

loans.name: Elvi Dinora

texts.es: Elvi es una mujer de 45 años de edad es una mujer tenaz que desde muy joven aprendió a elaborar chocolate artesanal a base de cacao, azúcar y canela, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sostener su hogar desde hace 15 años, ya que luego de prepararlo lo sale a vender por las calles de su cantón. Ella vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 18 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 5 años. Elvi desea cubrir la demanda de productos con la que cuenta por lo que solicita un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en: cacao, azúcar, canela, productos de belleza, etc. Para continuar con su negocio y que este le permita mantener la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvi is a 45-year-old tenacious woman. At a young age, she learned to make artisanal chocolate with cacao, sugar, and cinnamon. Thanks to this business, she has been able to support her household for the past 15 years because she sells the chocolates on the street in her canton after she makes them.

She lives with her husband and their two children, ages 12 and 18; they have lived in their own home for the past 5 years. Elvi would like to meet the current demand for her products, so she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in cacao, sugar, cinnamon, beauty products, etc. This way, she will be able to continue with her business and maintain financial stability in her home.

loans.use: to invest in cacao, sugar, cinnamon, beauty products, etc.

loans.name: Zhyrgal

texts.ru: Жыргал 59 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей, двое живут вместе с Жыргал. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес в 1984 году. Благодаря упорному труду Жыргал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 2 лошади и 5 коз. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жыргал обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка и 10 овец. Вырученные доходы от бизнеса Жыргал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и накопить на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Zhyrgal is 59 years old, married and a mother of 5 children, two of whom live with her. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1984. Thanks to Zhyrgal's hard work, today her farm contains 2 cows, 10 sheep, 2 horses and 5 goats. In order to further develop her business, Zhyrgal requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a bull and 10 sheep. Zhyrgal plans to invest the received earnings from the business into further increasing her livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a bull and ten sheep in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Esperanza Caridad

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza de 21  años  de edad, es soltera no tiene hijos que dependen de ella no  tiene casa propia  vive con sus padres en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace  01  año al negocio de venta  de helados como paletas, conos y más.
Doña Esperanza es una joven emprendedora que desea salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra  helados de fresa, chocolate, vainilla, etc.  Espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su familia y a su vez le permita mejorar su negocio y así tener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de Esperanza es tener un buen negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- Noviembre del 2014.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza is 21 years old, single, and has no dependent children. She does not have a home of her own, so she lives with her parents in a community of San Lorenzo, which is in southern Honduras. For the past year she has been selling frozen treats such as popsicles, ice cream cones, and other items.

Doña Esperanza is an enterprising young woman who wants to get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to buy strawberry, chocolate, and vanilla ice cream, as well as other products. Esperanza hopes that this investment will allow her to move forward along with her family. At the same, she expects to improve her business and have better earnings.

Her dream is to have a good business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2014

loans.use: to buy ice cream (strawberry, vanilla, and chocolate) and other products for her business.

loans.name: Hassan
