texts.en: Hassan is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Friday, Yakubu and Shedrak. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Hassan would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hassan can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Hassan  spoke of his  ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kyzzhibek

texts.ru: Кызжибек, 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Кызжибек средне-специальное образование, она работает социальным работником, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад с суммы 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, Кызжибек на сегодняшний день имеет 1 корову и 30 овец. На участке мерою 2,0 Га собственной и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кызжибек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Kyzzhibek is 50 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Kyzzhibek has a specialized secondary education and works as a social worker. Also, to provide additional income for her family, she and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 20 years, starting with 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kyzzhibek's hard work, today she has 1 cows and 30 sheep. She grows beans on 2.0 hectares of owned and 1.0 hectares of leased land. In order to further develop her business, Kyzzhibek requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 12 sheep. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Patiant and Rufai.  

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Irimiya would have had to sell his maize for low prices, soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Irimiya can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later, for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. 

When asked, Irimiya spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en:
Mohammad Ali is a 22-year-old single man. Due to the low financial situation of his family, he left school at an early age and, ten years ago, started working as a plumber to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family.

Throughout the years, Mohammad gained experience and he became able to work on his own. He is a hard working and ambitious man who is trying desperately to develop his own plumbing business, thus he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. He wants to buy new plumbing tools which will facilitate his business and help him in providing his customers with better, quick service.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new plumbing tools to facilitate his business

loans.name: Jose Andres

texts.es: Don Jose tiene 54 años y vive en Managua, la capital de Nicaragua. Se dedica al oficio de guarda de seguridad, profesión que ya ejercita desde hace 7 años. Es un trabajo mal pagado y Don Jose hace muchas horas extras para aumentar un poco sus ingresos y poderle ofrecer unas buenas condiciones de vida a su familia. El gran sueño de Don Jose es terminar la construcción de su casa para que sus hijos tengan donde vivir bonito y seguro. Ahora está por hacerse abuelo lo cual le motiva aún más en mejorar su vivienda. Con los préstamos anteriores ya pudo construir un baño y un nuevo cuarto, lo que fue de gran impacto para su familia dado que ahora viven en condiciones más higiénicas y todos tienen más espacio. Con este nuevo crédito Don Jose desea levantar una pared para brindarle mayor seguridad y privacidad a su hogar. Va a comprar bloques, cemento, arena, hierro y piedrín para empezar la construcción.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is 54 years old and lives in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is a security guard, a job he’s had for seven years. It’s poorly paid work so Jose does a lot of overtime to increase his income a little so he can provide his family with better living conditions.

Jose’s greatest dream is to complete the house that he is building so that his children have a nice, safe place in which to live. Now he’s about to become a grandfather which has given him an even greater incentive to improve his home.
With previous loans he was able to build a bathroom and a new bedroom. These had a great impact on his family as they then could live in a more hygienic and bigger space. Jose plans to use this new loan to build a wall to give greater security and privacy to his home. He is going to buy blocks, cement, sand, steel rods, and gravel so he can start construction.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La señora Norma,   es de la ciudad de Santaní, está casada, y comenta que es dueña de un salón de belleza, también vende ropas y también tiene servicios de masajes, es una mujer muy trabajadora y que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Norma is from the city of Santaní. She is married and says that she is the owner of a beauty salon. She also sells clothes and provides massage services. Norma is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead, which is why she is trying to do her best.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of clothes to sell. This will help her to continue her sales just as before. Norma appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es un hombre separado de su esposa y se ha quedado a cargo de 6 hijos, 3 de ellos todavía viven con el cliente y asisten al colegio Jose vive en El Alto en una zona alejada, al menos tiene casa propia aunque esta sea de ladrillo y cemento, la familia se da modos para no estar incomodos en el lugar Desde hace un año Jose ha empezado a trabajar en el ramo del transporte publico, por un tiempo se dedico al comercio de libros pero no tuvo mucho exito  Jose quiere un prestamo para mantenimiento de vehiculo, compra de llantas y gran cantidad de aceite, el prestamo le sera de mucha utilidad puesto que puede ahorrar mucho en el futuro Jose es la unica persona que tiene ingresos y esta muy agradecido de poder postular para un credito en kiva
texts.en:
Jose is a man who is separated from his wife and he has been left in charge of his six children, three of whom still live with him and attend school. Jose lives in a remote area called El Alto. At least he has his own home and although it is made out of brick and cement, the family has ways of being comfortable there. 

Jose has been working in the public transportation business for the past year. For a while he made a living selling books but he was not very successful. 

Jose would like a loan to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle, to buy tires and a large quantity of oil. The loan will be very useful to him, because he will be able to save a lot in the future. Jose is the only person that has an income and he is thankful for being able to apply for a loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle, to buy tires and a large quantity of oil.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: Juana es una microempresaria exitosa en su vida laboral, tiene la edad de 43 años, acompañada y propietaria de una pulpería desde hace doce años, es el ciclo número cincuenta y uno que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una mujer trabajadora y responsable con sus cuotas de pagos, este crédito lo solicita para la compra de granos básicos como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, gaseosas, etc., con los créditos anteriores ha logrado ampliar su negocio, además logró comprar una cocina, esto la ha motivado a seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is a small entrepreneur who has been successful in her work life. She is 43 years old, in a relationship, and the owner of a grocery for the past 12 years. This is her 51st cycle with ADIM, which has provided her with loans for her business. Juana has demonstrated that she is a hardworking and responsible woman when it comes to her payments.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, oil, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, sodas, and other products. With her previous loans, Juana was able to expand her business. In addition, she was able to purchase a stove. Juana is motivated to continue investing in her business so that she can keep improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar, oil, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: Sandra Emelina

texts.es:
Sandra, de 38 años de edad, está casada, y vive con sus 2 hijos que actualmente estudian. Además, está cuidando una sobrina, ya que su hermana emigro hacia los Estados Unidos y la dejó para que se la cuidara mientras termina su estancia laboral fuera del país. 
Sandra, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero además de eso, también ayuda a su madre a vender frutas y verduras todos los días por la tarde en el mercado municipal. 

Sandra, le ayuda a su madre desde hace 6 años, ella recibe ingresos por este trabajo pero también recibe ayuda de su esposo y es así como mantienen su familia.

Sandra, ocupará el dinero del préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como piso, cemento y pagar mano de obra, para terminar de construir su vivienda, con este dinero ella construirá en menos tiempo.

Sandra, sueña con tener un negocio muy fuerte en un futuro, donde no solo se venda verduras y frutas, si no que este bien surtido con variedad de productos de la canasta básica.
texts.en:
Sandra, age 38, is married and lives with her two children who are currently studying. She also cares for a niece, since her sister moved to the United States and left her daughter to Sandra to care for while she is outside of the country.
Sandra does the housework but also helps her mother to sell fruits and vegetables every day in the afternoons at the municipal market.
Sandra has helped her mother for six years. She makes an income from this work but also gets help from her husband. This is how they support their family.
Sandra will use this loan money to buy construction materials such as flooring and cement, and pay the labourers to finish building her home. With this loan the home will be finished in less time.
Sandra dreams of having a very strong business in the future, where she will not only sell fruits and vegetables but also a good stock of basic staples.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as flooring and cement and to pay the labourers to finish the work on her home.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
El lugar donde viven las integrantes del grupo “El Arbolito” es muy alegre, los habitantes de dicha localidad celebran  fiestas en grande, la más reciente es la de la Virgen de Guadalupe que se celebra en toda la república Mexicana. 

Silvia quien pertenece al grupo, es una persona muy sonriente, siempre está de muy buen humor, es simpática y trabajadora. Ella tiene 24 años de edad y está casada con el señor Adrián quien trabaja como constructor de casas, juntos formaron una familia con tres hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian, el más pequeño aún es un bebé.

Hace cuatro años Silvia inició vendiendo algunos dulces afuera de su casa en una pequeña mesita, pero escuchó hablar de VisionFund y solicitó un préstamo para hacer crecer su negocio. Desde entonces ha invertido en más dulces y frituras que  ahora ya también vende dulces afuera de algunas escuelas. Con sus ganancias, además pudo iniciar un negocio de compra y venta de ropa y zapatos usados, productos que compra en la capital del país y que revende únicamente los miércoles en un pequeño mercado de su comunidad. 

Además de vender dulces, frituras, ropa, zapatos Silvia también forma parte de la venta de alimentos aunque lo hace por temporada. Por ejemplo, vende quelites y capulines que prepara en dulce y tamales y hace poco decidió vender gelatinas que ella misma prepara en casa. “Afortunadamente me está ayudando mucho el negocio de las gelatinas, me hacen pedidos para los eventos importantes de la comunidad o de las escuelas”.

La dificultad que enfrenta Silvia es la falta de dinero para comprar todo el material que necesita, pero ella está muy agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque los préstamos le han permitido levantar sus negocios y quiere seguir creciendo, su meta es construir un local estable donde pueda mostrar todos sus productos. En esta ocasión Silvia necesita invertir en todas sus actividades, comprará dulces, ingredientes para su comida y un poco más de ropa y zapatos.

Las integrantes del grupo son Leonarda, María de la Luz R., Beatriz, Alicia, Juana, María de la Luz M. y Oralia, todas ellas tienen la misma actividad de crianza de borregos e invertirán en más animalitos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco del municipio, detrás se puede ver el quiosco y una parte de la iglesia católica, Silvia está cargando a un bebé con una cobija amarilla.
texts.en:
The place where members of the group "The Arbolito" live is very cheerful.  The residents of the town hold large celebrations, the most recent was for the Virgin of Guadalupe, which is celebrated all over the Republic of Mexico.  Silvia is a member of this group.  She is a person who is always smiling and in a good mood, and she is also pleasant and hardworking. She is 24 years old, and is married to Adrian, who works building homes.  Together, they formed a family with 3 children, 2 of whom attend school, as the youngest is just a baby.  

Four years ago, Silvia started up a business selling sweets outside her home from a small table.  But she listened to a talk at the VisionFund, and requested a loan to expand her business.  Ever since, she has invested in more sweets and snacks that she now also sells outside some schools. With her earnings, she was also able to start up a business buying and selling used clothing and shoes, products that she buys in the capital and then re-sells only on Wednesdays in a small market in her community.  In addition to selling sweets, snacks, clothing, and shoes, Silvia also participates in a business selling seasonal foods.  For example, she sells greens and Mexican black cherries that she makes into a dessert, and she also makes tamales.  Recently, she decided to also sell gelatins that she makes in her house.  "Fortunately, the business selling gelatins is helping me a lot, as I am getting orders for special events in the community and for schools," she says.

The difficulty that Silvia faces is the lack of money to buy all of the materials she needs.  But she is very grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because the loans have enabled her to grow her businesses.  She wants to continue to grow, her goal is to build a shop where she could display all of her products.  At this time, she needs to invest in all of her businesses.  She will buy sweets, ingredients for her dishes, and more clothing and shoes.  

The other members of this group are:  Leonarda, María de la Luz R., Beatriz, Alicia, Juana, María de la Luz M. and Oralia.  They all have businesses raising sheep, and will invest in more animals.  

Note: this photograph was taken on the steps of a municipal gazebo.  Behind them, you see the gazebo and part of a Catholic church.  Silvia is holding a baby wearing yellow.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dishes, and more clothing and shoes to sell

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Maritza Beatriz

texts.es:
Maritza es una señora de 46 años, separada de su conyugue muchos años, actualmente vive con un hijo mayor que también trabaja y le ayuda a su madre. Ambos viven en casa arrendada varios años en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, una ciudad conocida en el país por ser una zona productiva y comercial, con un clima cálido húmedo agradable.
Maritza es una madre muy trabajadora, desde hace 2 años se ha dedicado a criar pollos, los mismos que vende todos los meses a clientela fija, los tiene en su casa en un pequeño galpón elaborado por ella. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio, ahora solicita un crédito para poder incrementar su producción, quiere comprar más pollo y más balanceado. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa y la institución pudo ayudarle  un crédito para que pueda comprar lo que necesita para su negocio. Maritza está muy agradecida porque con esto podrán mejorar sus ventas y crecer mucho más. Se siente muy entusiasmada para seguir trabajando y mejorar poco a poco su negocio.
texts.en:
Maritza is a 46-year-old woman who has been separated from her spouse for many years. Currently, she lives with an adult son who also works and helps his mother. The two have lived in a rented house for several years in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city known nationally for being a productive commercial zone with a pleasantly warm and humid climate.

Maritza is a very hardworking mother. For two years, she has earned her living raising chickens. She sells them every month to regular customers. She has them in her house in a little poultry shed that she built. 

She turned to Fundación Alternativa, and the institution was able to help her with a loan so that she could buy what she needed for her business. Maritza is very grateful because with the loan, she will be able to improve her sales and grow a lot more. She feels very enthusiastic about continuing her work and improving her business little by little.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and compound feed. With the income, she would like to grow professionally.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en: Zuhro is a strong woman who was born in 1975. She lives in a rural area in the midst of her region. Zuhro is married and has two children. She has land where she plants potatoes and carrots. It is hard for Zuhro to work alone. Her husband does not work but he helps her with the business. Zuhro wants to buy cattle for feeding and then selling. She needs financial support for her business.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo was born in 1973. She is divorced and has 3 children. She is the sole provider for her children, and so she works hard to earn a living.

Shahlo is a very hardworking woman. She has been busy with farming activities for more than 5 years. Shahlo grows onions on 1 hectare of land and wheat on 3 hectares of land. She sells her harvest in a local market. Shahlo manages her business alone. She provides food and clothes for her children from the profit of her business.

Shahlo's dream is to see her children graduate from higher education. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS (Somoni) to buy mineral fertilizers for growing onion and wheat. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for growing onions and wheat

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is a 56-year-old widow and had five children. She is managing a store for income. She sells grocery items to the people in her village.

Leticia wanted to keep selling good products so she will gain more profits from her small business. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional groceries to sell such as soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, sugar, soap, and shampoo.

Leticia will save the profits to pay her weekly amortization and save another part of her income as revolving capital in her business.

Beside her in the photo is a supervisor visiting her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, sugar, soap, and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Raul Jr

texts.en: Raul is a 28-year-old man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He earns a living through his pedal rickshaw transport business. Raul has been in the business for more than 15 years now. Raul would like to take a loan to purchase a new motorcycle which he will use to transport his passengers. This loan will help him improve his earnings and income. In the future, Raul hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima is a married woman who has been running her own beauty parlor on her street. She does her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Saima is a responsible mother of 5 children. Her husband is not in good physical shape to be employed so she works hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. Saima has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams, for generating more income to bear her household expenditures efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor for generating more income to bear her household expenditures efficiently.

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
Susanita is 55 years old and a married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Susanita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Susanita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

In the future, Susanita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: María De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles, tiene la edad de 41 años, está en Unión Libre, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo, las condiciones de clima y otras que en este tiempo favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo, ella espera incrementar sus ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas. FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con muchas facilidades y a una tasa de interés accesible, por lo que ella espera cumplir los objetivos planteados con respecto al préstamo
texts.en:
41-year old María de los Ángeles is 41 years old and lives with her partner and their two children who are her first priority. With the loan she plans to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and hire laborers to help with her coffee crop. She will take advantage of the fertile soil in the area where she lives, as well as the good climate that favors the production of coffee. With these improvements to her crop, María expects to increase income and in this way improve the living conditions of her family and achieve other objectives. 

FUDECOSUR has provided her with a loan and easy repayment terms so she expects to be able to fulfill the requirements of the loan.

loans.use: get help with her coffee crop

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with three children, who all attend school.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for seven years and also earns an income from a tricycle passenger service.

Gina aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sozulkan

texts.ru: Созулкан, 32 года, замужем, есть трех летний сын. Образование у Созулкан среднее. Она очень ответственная, аккуратная и трудолюбивая. В поиске дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Созулкан в 2005 году начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет 3 коровы. На ежедневной основе она реализует экологически чистое, вкусное молоко. Прибыль от бизнеса позволяет Созулкан разводить скот и заготавливать для него корма на зиму. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для получения приплода скота и увеличения объемов реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Созулкан планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства, чтобы накопить на покупку дома.
texts.en: Sozulkan is 32 years old, married and has a three-year-old son. Sozulkan has a secondary education. She is very responsible, meticulous and hard working. In search of additional income for her family, Sozulkan started an agricultural business in 2005. Today, she has 3 cows on her farm. She sells ecologically-clean and delicious milk on a daily basis. The profit from the business allows Sozulkan to raise livestock and prepare livestock feed for the winter. In order to further develop her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy a dairy cow in order to get livestock offspring and increase milk sales. Sozulkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business to save money to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase sales of ecologically-clean milk

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra is a single woman She has 51 years old and she is mother of 3 All their sons are adults and they are living on their own Sandra is living in La Paz with her parents and her aunts in her family s house Sandra has been s a school teacher for 20 years and she also sell shoes since two months ago Sandra is a very enthusiastic person and she asks for a loan to buy women clothes and to sell it for the christmas season in comfortable payments for month Sandra is the only person at her house that makes money and she will apreciate a lot the help from kiva
texts.en: Sandra is a single woman. She is 51 years old and she is the mother of three. All their sons are adults and they are living on their own. Sandra is living in La Paz with her parents and her aunts in her family's house. Sandra has been a school teacher for 20 years and she also has been selling shoes for two months. Sandra is a very enthusiastic person and she is asking for a loan to buy women's clothes and to sell them for the Christmas season in comfortable payments per month. Sandra is the only person at her house that makes money and she would appreciate a lot the help from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and to sell them for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Batoul

texts.en: Batoul is a 34-year-old married mother of two children. She has worked in a grocery shop for the past thirteen years to help her husband in covering their family's needs and expenses. Batoul is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is trying desperately to develop her business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with more requested products to satisfy her customers' needs during the Christmas season. Batoul hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more requested products to satisfy her customers' needs during the Christmas season

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: José es un hombre de 32 años de edad instalo hace 2 años una pequeña granja de pollos la cual desde muy temprano se despierta a cuidar, ya que sabe que es su único ingreso económico y el cual le permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Él vive con compañera de vida, sus 2 hijos de 19 y 7 años de edad y su pequeña nieta de 1 mes de edad. José sabe que la mejor época para su negocio es navidad y fin de año, por lo que desea invertir en su negocio para obtener más y mejores ingresos en esta época, para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, vitaminas y materiales para elaborar concentrado.
texts.en:
José is a 32-year-old man who set up a small chicken farm two years ago. He gets up early in the morning to tend to his chickens, since he knows they are his only source of income, which allows him to support his family. He lives with his life partner, their two children who are ages nineteen and seven, and their little granddaughter, who is one month old. 

José knows that the best time of the year for his business is Christmas and New Year's, which is why he wants to invest in his business in order to make more income during the season. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to make this investment by purchasing chickens, vitamins, and supplies to make concentrated animal feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins, and supplies to make concentrated animal feed.

loans.name: Safar

texts.en:
Safar is 21 years old. He is a smart, young man. Safar is not married and lives with his parents. He has a lot of friends and his hobby is playing football.

Safar is a student in his 4th course at Tajikistan Economic University. He studies full-time. Safar studies well and reads a lot of books. He usually goes to the library.

He is asking for a loan because he must pay for university tuition.

He awaits your mercy and in advance thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Marvin Noe

texts.es: Marvin de 22 años de edad se desempeña como vendedor ambulante de prendas de vestir, pero además es auxiliar de bodega en una empresa cercana, lo que le ha permitido mantener la economía de su hogar. Él vive con su padre y su hermana en vivienda propia desde hace muchos años, por lo que es reconocido en su cantón como una persona trabajadora y respetuosa. Marvin desea invertir en su negocio ya que esta época de festividades es cuando las ventas mejoran por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisas, etc.
texts.en:
Marvin is 22 years old and works as a street vender, selling garments. He is also a warehouse assistant in a nearby business, which has allowed him to financially support his household. He has lived with his father and his sister in a house that they own for many years, so he is well-known in his community as a respectful and hardworking person. 

Marvin would like to invest in his business, since the holiday season is when sales improve. That's why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Rene Alfredo

texts.es: Rene es un hombre de 22 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida. Él es un joven trabajador que se gana la vida como operario de una empresa de elaboración de prendas de vestir, pero además se gana la vida vendiendo ropa para dama y caballero, perfumería y calzado, y desea invertir en este negocio ya que se acerca la mejor época del año que es la navideña, en la cual las ventas son mejores al igual que las ganancias,  por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, calzado, perfumería, etc. Y de esta forma brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Rene is a 22-year old man who lives in his own home with this wife.  He is a hard-working young man who earns his living as an operator in a clothing factory.  In addition, he earns his living selling women's and men's clothing, perfume and footwear.  Rene wants to invest in that business, as the best season of the year is approaching- the Christmas Season.  During that time, sales are the best, as are the profits.  That is why Rene is requesting a loan from FUSAI, so he can invest in pants, skirts, blouses, footwear, perfumes etc.  He will then be able to offer his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, footwear, perfumes etc. for resale.

loans.name: Wilemia

texts.en:
Wilemia is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Wilemia has been in the business for more than 14 years now. 

As of now, she is requesting to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell like noodles, canned goods, eggs, biscuits and bread, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. This loan will enable her to improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers to her store.  

Wilemia dreams of making her business sustainable and productive in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and other goods to sell

loans.name: Yanett Dionisia

texts.es:
La socia Yanett Dionisia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de plata, la  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas, la socia continua vendiendo pulseras, aretes de acuerdo lo que sus clientes que piden, la socia desea poder agrandar su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de collares y anillos.
texts.en:
Yanett Dionisia continues to manage her business of selling silver. She appreciates the assistance that has been offered, so she promises to complete her loan payments in a disciplined manner. Yanett continues to sell bracelets and earrings based on what her customers order. She wants to expand her business so that she can help her family move forward.

Yanett Dionisia is requesting a loan in order to buy necklaces and rings.

loans.use: to buy necklaces and rings.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is a 26-year-old married man and the father of a three-month-old child from Iloilo, Philippines. He has been engaged in the motorcycle transport business for several years now. This is the source of his income. Roger is asking to take a loan for the full payment of his motorcycle. This loan will help him improve his business, thus augmenting his income. He also wants to save money for the future schooling of his child.

loans.use: to pay the full payment of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ruth, a 38-year-old mother of three children, who resides in the Nandihills area in Kenya. She is very humble and a go-getter. Ruth has been practicing farming for the last 3 years on her small plot, where she does mixed farming. Ruth enjoys farming very much, and every day she wakes up to go to the farm and improve her life. Through farming, she has been able to take care of her large family and provide them with their basic needs. 

Having the traits of a go-getter, Ruth has always dreamed big. She has a vision of owning a large cereal-selling shop. She is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to start the shop and make her dream come true. With your loan, Ruth will be able to improve her income level and to comfortably take care of her family. Ruth’s projections are that, by the end of the first year, she would be able to start another cereal-selling shop, which means more income and improved living conditions. Through the profits generated from the business, she would be able to repay the loan and provide a secure future for her children and husband.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is married and works hard to support her family. She sells dried fish and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Joan has borrowed and successfully repaid seven prior loans through NWTF. She is now borrowing 12,000 PHP to buy more dried fish to sell. She is working hard to build her business incrementally and save enough money to further expand it.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ume  Kalsoom

texts.en: Ume Kalsoom is a 48-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children. Ume Kalsoom is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Emmanuel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Obadiya, Rejoice and Kefas. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to provide for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. 

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% more than the market price at harvest. When asked, Emmanuel  spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to ensure his children are educated and have professional jobs.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees and uniforms, thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Kun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province, Kun is a 39-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Rice farming has been the main source of her family’s income for 29 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 12,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.

Kun’s group consists of three members who have just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Kun, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to build a proper latrine for use by her family so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine for use by her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is widowed and has four children. She works hard to support her family. She has a fish vendng business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from a general store.  

Janice requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Corali

texts.es: Corali is a single woman she has no children and she lives alone in La Paz wich is very hard for any entrepreneur since she has to pay the rent their food, etc. Corali parent s live in another country and she sells  women accesories (beauty products, hair accesories and other stuff related) since she was 15 Corali wants to take advantage of the chistmas season so she is asking for a loan to sell toys Corali doesn t have nobody to help her that is why se will apreciate a lot the help from kiva
texts.en: Corali is a single woman. She has no children and she lives alone in La Paz, which is very hard for any entrepreneur since she has to pay the rent, their food, etc. Corali's parents live in another country and she has sold women's accessories (beauty products, hair accessories and other related items) since she was 15. Corali wants to take advantage of the Christmas season so she is asking for a loan to sell toys. Corali doesn't have anybody to help her and that is why she will appreciate a lot the help from Kiva.

loans.use: to sell toys

loans.name: Maria Magaly

texts.es:
María tiene 39 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos vive en el canton Echeandia provincia de Bolivar pertenece a la ventanilla rural Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Solicita el credito para comprar mas mesas para el restaurant y pintar para dar un mejor servicio a los clientes y mejorar el negocio para el bienestar de la familia ya que es la unica actividad que realiza, 
Realiza las compras en Guaranda en el Mercado 10 de Noviembre, Su sueño es comprarse una casa para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, en su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the canton of Echeandia in Bolivar Province. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women).

She is requesting a loan in order to buy additional tables for her restaurant and to paint it so that she can provide better service to her customers. Improving her business will be to the benefit of her family since this is her only source of income.

María makes her purchases in Guaranda at the November 10th Market. Her dream is to buy a house so that she can provide a better quality of life for her children. In her free time, she enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to paint her restaurant and to buy additional tables.

loans.name: Kundan

texts.en: Kundan is a 60-year-old married woman who has been doing the business of animal purchasing and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of three children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Madame Awa, mariée et mère de famille, s’active dans le commerce depuis 2008. C’est grâce au premier crédit pris à l’IMCEC, qu’elle a démarré son activité. Avec cinquante mille, elle a acheté des habits pour enfants, des pantalons et des body pour revendre. Depuis lors, elle a fructifié son capital, et a réussi à ouvrir une mini-boutique, où elle s’occupe elle-même de vendre. Awa ouvre de 8h à 13h et de 16h à 18h. Les crédits et leurs résultats positifs ont beaucoup impactés sur sa situation aussi bien dans le cadre de la scolarité de ses enfants, des conditions alimentaires de la famille que de sa possibilité d’épargner régulièrement afin de prévoir l’avenir et de mettre toute sa famille dans de bonnes dispositions.
texts.en:
Awa, a wife and a mother, has been active in the business since 2008. It's thanks to her first loan from IMCEC that she started up her business. With fifty thousand, she bought clothes for children, pants, and onesies to resell. Since then, her profits have grown and she succeeded in opening a mini-boutique, where she alone is in charge of sales. Awa's store is open from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. and from 4 p.m. to 6 p.m.

The loans and their positive outcomes have had an immense impact on her situation, as well as her children's schooling, and on her family's nutritional conditions. They have also given her the possibility to regularly save money in order to plan for the future and to create good conditions for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for children, pants, and onesies to resell.

loans.name: Muhdosa

texts.ru: Мухдоса женщина 40 лет ,замужем,мать троих детей.Она получила педагогическое образование.На протяжение 5 лет Мухдоса работала учителем английского языка.Но учительской зарплаты не хватало даже на ежедневные нужды ,поэтому Мухдоса решила заняться разведением скота у себя на участке земли.Сейчас у неё в стаде десять баранов.Она их откармливает и продаёт.Её муж работает бригадиром на стройке.Они трудятся день и ночь чтобы прокормить свою семью,чтобы поставить на ноги своих детей. Мухдоса планирует увеличить поголовье своего стада,но у нее нет полной суммы денег.Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за получением кредита.Мухдоса надеется,что  организация  Арванд откликнется на ее просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную ей сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие во всех начинаниях.
texts.en: Muhdosa is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She obtained pedagogical education. Muhdosa spent 5 years working as an English-language teacher, but because a teacher's salary was not enough even for daily needs, Muhdosa decided to get involved in breeding livestock on her land. Now she has a herd of ten sheep. She fattens up and sells them. Her husband works as a supervisor at construction site. They work day and night to feed their family and put their children on their feet. Muhdosa is planning to increase her herd headcount, but does not have a sufficient amount to do this. This is why she requested a loan from MDO Arvand. Muhdosa hopes that the Arvand organization will be sympathetic to her request for help and disburse the necessary amount to her. She is grateful in advance for the support and trust in all of her initiatives.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Linda  Del Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es una señora de 44 años, soltera, sin hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Cuidad conocida en el país por ser el puente que une a la sierra de la costa.
Pilar es una señora muy trabajadora, desde hace 10 años ella cría pollos, ha hecho un pequeño galpón en su casa donde los tiene por unas semanas luego los vende, ya es conocida en el sector porque ella los alimenta más con maíz y salen pollos criollo, por ello cuenta con clientela fija.
El crédito lo va a invertir en la ampliación de galpones y compra de más pollos ya que desea entregarlos para navidad y año nuevo. Se siente feliz porque gracias a los pequeños créditos los microempresarios pueden salir adelante y superarse.
texts.en: Pilar is woman of 44, single, and has no children. She lives in her parents' house in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a city known in the country for being the bridge that unites the highlands with the coast. Pilar is a very hard-working woman and has been raising chickens for 10 years. She has built a small coop in her home where she keeps them for a few weeks before selling them. She is already known in the area because she feeds them mainly corn and they turn out as creole chickens. This is why she has a steady clientele. She's going to use the loan to expand the chicken coop and buy more chickens as she wishes to supply them for Christmas and New Year's. She feels happy because thanks to the small loans to the business persons she can succeed and move forward in life.

loans.use: To expand her coops and buy more chickens.

loans.name: Faa Yaa Wende Group

texts.fr:
Madame MARIAM est la  représentante  du groupe FAA YAA WENDE.  Sur la photo, elle est en habit rouge. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 13 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Madame fait la coiffure depuis 17ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son secteur.
Elle veut  s’acheter  30 à 40 paquets de mèche.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité en ouvrant d’autres salons de coiffure.
texts.en:
Mariam is the representative of the FAA YAA WENDE group. In the picture, she is dressed in red. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 13 and the youngest is three. The three of them go to school. She is responsible for the upkeep of six people. 

Mariam has been a hairdresser for 17 years. She gets her supplies from the market in her area. She would like to buy 30 to 40 packages of highlights. She would like to save her earnings. She is striving to build up her business by opening more hair salons.

loans.use: to buy 30 to 40 packages of highlights.

loans.name: Doen's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province, Doen is aged 37 years and married. He has three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school.

To support his family Doen and his wife have been farming rice for the past nineteen years. His rice brings him about 16,000 KHR a day to meet his family’s needs.

Doen is the head of this two-member group seeking a 400,000 KHR loan through VisionFund. He plans to use his portion to build a decent latrine for his family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for his family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Chim's Group

texts.en:
Chim’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province, in Cambodia. Chim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family. 

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is married and blessed with four lovely children. His primary sources of income are milk selling and cattle farming. Deciding to practice cattle farming was not difficult for Eric, since he was brought up on a cattle-keeping homestead. “It is in [my] blood," according to Eric.

For the past ten years, Eric has been earning a decent income from cattle rearing. Now the demand is overwhelming and he wants to expand his cattle farming, but his biggest challenge is limited funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional cows.

Cattle raising has become one of the greatest aspects of agriculture in western Uganda because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs; it’s a profitable and less strenuous business. Many cattle keepers find a sense of fulfillment in having a farm of cows.

With your loan, Eric is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As the times keep getting harder, Eric is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz is a single woman she has no children an she lives with her parents in La Paz Luz is an honest and responsible lawyer and she continues working for a public entity Since 2 years ago Luz has started her own business selling shoes to her coworkers and other known people Luz needs a loan to buy women shoes, men shoes and children shoes Luz is the only person that makes money in her house so she needs the loan with urgency But Luz  is healthy and relies in the force of her entrepeneur nature
texts.en: Luz is a single woman. She has no children and she lives with her parents in La Paz. Luz is an honest and responsible lawyer and she continues working for a public entity. Two years ago Luz started her own business selling shoes to her coworkers and other people she knows. Luz needs a loan to buy women's shoes, men's shoes, and children's shoes. Luz is the only person that makes money in her house so she needs the loan with urgency. But Luz  is healthy and relies on the force of her entrepreneur nature.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes, men's shoes, and children shoes

loans.name: Dilnavoz

texts.en:
Dilnavoz was born in 1993. She is a young and smart woman. Dilnavoz is not married and she lives with her parents. 

Dilnavoz studies at the university. She is a student of the second course in Medical College. She studies well and, after classes, helps her parents to grow potatoes and other kinds of vegetables. She dreams to work in any hospital and to treat sick people. 

Dilnavoz is asking for a loan to pay for tuition fees. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly is a 44 year old dried fish vendor from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is married and has four children. Rolly has been in the business for more than 10 years now.

Rolly is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With a loan, Rolly will be able to improve his stocks thus allowing him to sell more to his customers.

In the future, Rolly has hopes of making his business more sustainable and profitable. Moreover, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 59 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase stylish clothes to resell.

loans.name: Kimhak's Group

texts.en:
Kimhak, 51, lives in a rural village of Kampong Speu province’s Phnom Srouch district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children, both of whom are still in school. For the last 20 years, Kimhak and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. To add up more income, she also works as a garment worker in a local area. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day.

This is the first loan for Kimhak with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to construct a new latrine for her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine to use.

loans.use: to construct a new latrine for her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, trabaja independientemente realizando ensamblaje y  mantenimiento de computadoras y también brinda servicios de electricidad.
El crédito lo requiere para comprar herramientas, programas de instalacion y actualizacion para mejorar sus servicios junto con el avance de la tecnología.
René sigue soltero, no tiene hijos pero ahora se ha trasladado a vivir con su hermana porque esta necesita ayuda y no le gusta dejar la casa sola que esta ubicada en  La Paz. Rene estara muy agradecido con la ayuda de Kiva y es necesario contarles que también aporta para los gastos en casa de su hermana
texts.en:
René works independently, doing computer assembly and maintenance. He also provides electrical services.

He needs the loan to buy tools and software for installations and updates in order to improve his services and keep up with advancing technology. 

René is still single and has no children, but now he has moved in with his sister because she needs help and doesn't like leaving the house vacant. The house is located in La Paz. 

René will be very grateful for the help from Kiva. It should be mentioned that he is also contributing the the household expenses at his sister's house.

loans.use: to buy tools and software for installations and updates

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en: Yunusa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. He joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Mubarak, Abdulmalik and Ibrahim. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. When asked, Yunusa spoke of his ambition to use the additional income to educate his children, eventually hoping to make more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: To pay for children's school fees and uniforms thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is 54 years old, married and the mother of two children. Safia is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, thread, and frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good profit. This monetary help can bring Safia closer to her dream of providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn a good profit.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nasreen  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en:
Sarath (shown in photo) is 26 years old, single and lives with his family. He is a student and has worked as a quality controller for one year in his experience.

Sarath lives at Keansvay district, Kandal province, Cambodia, around 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Now, he is in his third year, semester one, at Nortn University, Phnom Penh, with a major in Information Technology. He would like to apply for a loan for pay his school fee.

He will graduate on 30-Aug-2015. He strongly hopes that he will become a professional IT in the future.

loans.use: to pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza was born in 1988. She is a hardworking woman. Firuza is a careful mother of three children. She has been busy with sewing national women's clothes for more than five years. She offers her services in her house and she makes a variety of women's clothes. Firuza has regular clients and her clients are her neighbors. Firuza’s children are little and she tries to offer comfortable living conditions for them. The windows of her house are old and she plans to change these old windows into plastic windows. Firuza is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy plastic windows for her house. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy plastic windows to change the windows of her house

loans.name: Tiato

texts.en:
Tiato does livestock farming in Narok town and has been in this business for 20 years now.  He is 44 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children. 

He will use this loan to buy more livestock for rearing and fattening and later selling at a profit. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy livestock for sell.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
En total son 20 mujeres inspiradas, que trabajan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar con la idea de aumentar sus ingresos 
 Forman parte del comité con el fundamento de ayudarse y más bien consideran una oportunidad de suma importancia para ellas para trabajar y obtener sus propios ingresos y poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Mercedes es una de las integrantes, ella contenta que se siente motivada por formar parte del comité ella pudo emprender una actividad para ganar dinero. Actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de comestibles que lo hace de manera constante y sobre pedidos, lo que le ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder ir mejorando.
La Sra. Mercedes pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para hacer sus comidas, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas.  Agradecen todas por la oportunidad que reciben que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
These 20 inspired women work each day with the thought of increasing their incomes so that they can provide for their household expenses. Being part of a committee is the foundation to helping one another. Most importantly, this is an essential opportunity for these women to work together so that the can earn their own income and help their families.

Sra. Mercedes is one of the members. She is pleased to say that she is excited about being part of her committee, which helped her to start a business so that she could earn money. Mercedes currently prepares food and does this from the constant stream of orders that she receives. This has helped her to continue improving.

Sra. Mercedes is requesting a loan in order to buy various supplies for making her dishes, which will allow her to continue her sales. All of the group members appreciate the opportunity they have received since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for his meat shop.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 6 years to 16 years old. She describes herself to be optimistic and hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to be a regional supplier of groceries within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have better living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a single man. He describes himself as having potential. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to expand his business well within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be courageous and disciplined. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes chairs, tables, beds, and other types of furniture. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of timber, nails, and other carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of timber, nails, and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Sem's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Steung Treng province, Sem is 33 years old. She grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn additional income via fish-catching. She can earn an income of about 23,600 KHR per day.

For Sem, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loan wisely and is improving her living conditions at a gradual pace.

She leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fishing instruments. She hopes that she can get more income than before.

loans.use: to buy fishing instruments.

location.town: Steung Treng Province, Sieam Bouk District

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem is 60 years old and married.  She deals in a business selling livestock. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000  to purchase more animals to boost her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to boost her sales.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley has a livestock selling business in Narok town and the business has been profitable. He is 24 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with four children.

He will use this loan to buy more stock of goats to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in the future he hopes to have a prosperous business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goats to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells flour, sugar, salt, washing soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Kampong Speu province’s Phnom Srouch district, Hun is aged 51 years and married with three children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. For the last several years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of the family’s income to make a living and they can earn about KHR 22,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 17,000 each day for future needs.

Hun has just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a latrine for use by her family. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to build a latrine for use by her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Aged 47 years, Kea is married and lives with his family in a rural area in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province. He is the father of ten children, five of whom are still dependent on him. He farms rice, making approximately 22,000 KHR a day. As a farmer, drought is his main challenge.

This will be Kea’s first loan with VisionFund. He is the leader of this two-member group seeking 400,000 KHR to be shared between the two. His plan is to use his loan portion to construct a decent latrine for his family’s use. He hopes this investment will help in keeping his family in good health.

loans.use: to construct a decent latrine for his family’s use.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Gabriela Jazmin

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven madre de 20 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeña nena en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, ciudad conocida por ser muy comercial y productiva, con un clima cálido húmedo.
Gabriela es una señora muy trabajadora, desde que terminó el colegio ella decidió trabajar, hace más de un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, sabanas, edredones y ropa interior, recorre visitando a sus clientes de casa en casa y también vende su mercadería por las redes sociales, le ha ido muy bien, ha podido ya ganarse clientela por la atención que ella les brinda.
Gabriela ahora necesita un pequeño crédito para poder capitalizarse, aprovechar y comprar los productos en oferta ya que se acerca un buen mes para incrementar sus ventas. Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por buenas referencias del sector y pudo obtener el crédito que necesitaba ya que en otras instituciones no le permitían por su edad, está muy feliz y agradecida con la institución y el proyecto Kiva r hacer posible que ella crezca con su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a 20-year-old young mother. She lives with her spouse and her little girl in her parents' house in the city of Santo Domingo, which is known for being a productive, commercial city with a warm, humid climate.

Gabriela is a very hardworking woman. From the moment she finished school, she decided to work. She has earned her living for more than one year selling clothing, sheets, comforters, and underwear. She travels house to house, visiting her customers. She also sells her merchandise through social media. It has been going very well for her; she has already been able to build a clientele because of the customer service that she provides.

Now Gabriela needs a small loan in order to strengthen her balance sheet and take advantage of sales by buying products, as a good month for increasing her sales is approaching. She turned to Fundación Alternativa on good recommendations in the area and was able to obtain the loan that she needed; in other institutions, they would not allow her to borrow because of her age. She is very happy and grateful to the institution and to the Kiva project for making it possible for her to grow her business.

loans.use: to strengthen her balance sheet and buy more discounted merchandise. This income will help her to grow more as a micro-businesswoman.

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en: Nafiu is a maize farmer. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nafiu would have had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nafiu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. Like other Babban Gona members, Nafiu is looking to earn a better income to provide more food and clothing for his family, and hopes to become the most profitable farmer in his community.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing for his family thereby eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 29-year-old working woman. Her husband is also shown in the photo. After her marriage, she felt that she should work to help support her family to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Najma is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently, she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 44-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchasing and selling with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers and generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Limbert

texts.es:
Limbert es un hombre de 34 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos varones de 5 y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de ferretería.
Él es optimista, feliz, de buena actitud, comprometido con su trabajo, generoso, amable, independiente y trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘villa Fátima’ un lugar caracterizado por el comercio informal de fruta proveniente del norte de la ciudad y por las paradas de transporte público con salidas a poblaciones del norte de la ciudad, de clima frío y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar. 
Limbert es de piel morena, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que le ayuda en el negocio y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela el menor se encuentra en el kínder. La familia vive en una casa familiar perteneciente a sus padres, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, alcantarillado y gas. Su negocio es la venta de artículos de ferretería como; tornillos, clavos, pegamento, herramientas, accesorios y otros. Su segunda actividad es la de transportista como taxi, mientras su esposa se ocupa de atender la ferretería. Ambas actividades logran que la familia pague sus gastos con normalidad. “trabajo realizando el servicio de radio taxi sin embargo hace un par de años emprendí mi negocio de ferretería; actualmente no cuento con mucho capital pero pienso abastecer mi ferretería…” comenta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia. Él desea realizar la reparación de su vehículo para poder transportar la mercadería que oferta en la ferretería. 
Es por esos motivos que Limbert solicita un préstamo para el arreglo de su vehículo para poder transportar las herramientas que comercia en su ferretería.
texts.en:
Limbert is a man of 34, married and has two children, boys, ages 5 and 8. He sells hardware items. He is optimistic, has a good attitude, is committed to his work, generous, friendly, independent and hard-working. He carries on his business in the Villa Fatima area, a place known for an informal fruit market for fruit coming from north of the city, and for the public transport stops with with departures to towns north of the city. 

It Is has a cold windy climate with winds that arrive from the mountains and is at an elevation of 3600 m above sea level. 

Limbert has dark skin, short black hair, and his mother tongue is Aymara. He speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business he does. He shares his life with his wife who helps him in the business and with their children. The eldest goes to school and the youngest is in kindergarten. The family lives in the family home belonging to his parents. It is built from brick,has potable water, electricity, sewer connection and gas. 

He sells hardware articles such as screws, nails, glue, tools, accessories and other items.  Has a second activity operating a taxi while his wife looks after the hardware store. Both activities help the family pay there household expenses on an everyday basis. "I work doing the radio taxi service, however couple of years ago I started my hardware business. Currently I don't have much capital but I intend to stock my hardware store. His dream is to have his own home.

He wishes to do repairs on his vehicle so that he can transport the to merchandise that he sells in the hardware store. This is the reason why Limbert is requesting a loan to fix his vehicle so that he can transport the tools that he sells at his hardware store.

loans.use: To fix his vehicle so that he can transport the tools that he sells in his hardware store.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es cliente de la institución de 29 años de edad, soltero y su negocio es la venta de zapatos deportivos.
Él es una persona, emprendedora, generosa,  independiente trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona Oeste  de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Un área caracterizada por el comercio informal y la manufactura, de clima cálido tropical; con una temperatura ambiente que varía durante el día entre 20-30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Luis es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello color castaño, su lengua materna español, vive en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de zapatos como; zapatos deportivos, Labor que realiza durante todas la semana sin descanso de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos a peatones y trabajadores de oficinas, restaurantes, y personas que trabajan en todo tipo de comercio. Sus productos mayormente de cuero son de gran competencia porque se ocupa de buscar los mejores y más atractivos tanto para varones como mujeres. “conozco las nuevas tendencias porque ando informada en mi rubro y sé qué modelo viene bien para cada ocasión…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia bajo techo para dejar de ambular. El desea realizar una inversión en su negocio por motivo de las fiestas de fin de año, para contar con variedad de modelos en todos los tamaños y así generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Esta es la 1 secuencia  de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de zapatos por mayor para complacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis, age 29 and single, is a client of the institution.  He sells athletic shoes.  He is an enterprising, generous, independent, and hard-working person.  He conducts his business in an itinerant manner in the western area of the city of Cochabamba.  The area is known for its informal commerce, manufacturing, and its warm tropical climate.  The temperature during the day varies between 20 and 30 degrees centigrade all year.

Luis has a dark complexion, is short, and has brown hair.  His mother tongue is Spanish.  He lives in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.

His business is selling shoes like athletic shoes.  He does this work in an itinerant manner every week without a break.  He sells his products to pedestrians and to people who work in offices, restaurants, and in all type of commerce.

His products are mostly leather and are very competitive.  This is because he takes the care to look for the best and most attractive shoes for men and women.  “I know the new trends because I keep informed in my field.  I know what style will go well for each occasion,” he comments.  

His dream is to have his own store with a roof in order to stop selling in an itinerant manner.  He wishes to invest in his business for the end of the year celebrations.  He wants to have a variety of styles in all sizes.  This way he will generate better income for the well-being of his family.  This is his first loan cycle with the institution.  He has been engaged in his business activity for five years.

These are the reasons that Luis is requesting a loan to buy a variety of shoes in bulk in order to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes in bulk in order to satisfy his customers.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Iloilo, Philippines. She operates a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her neighborhood.

Elna wants to expand her business but she lacks the financial resources to make it happen.

Elna is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, condiments, soap, and toiletries. With a loan, Elna will be able to increase her stocks, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Elna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, bread and biscuits, condiments, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en: Nasra is 25 years old, married and has four children. She has a business buying and selling livestock with the help of her husband. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR. She intends to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 42 years old, widowed and blessed with two children. 

Magdalene is a farmer, a business she has done for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Magdalene has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000 to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

With the anticipated profits, Magdalene will be able to educate her children. She hopes and dreams to become self reliant.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and manure

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman with nine children. She describes herself as optimistic and hard working. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be an established cereals distributor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better living standard. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals
